Reviews.Title: “New favorite hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BristolRI
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation at the Loews for a getaway weekend with my daughter through Priceline and was so thrilled with the accommodations. The room was HUGE by New York standards, the bed was incredibly comfortable and everyone there was really helpful. Loved the complimentary NY Times (even Sunday!) and the location was amazing for everything we had planned. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel- great location”
Reviews.Author: dermgoddess
Reviews.Content: I was here for business, for just 1 night. The room was more than adequate and the bed comfy. View from my room was so typical of NY as i looked into 3 other buildings. I have stayed in more luxurious hotels, and more modern hotels, but this hotel has style and grace.

Reviews.Title: “A trip down memory lane.”
Reviews.Author: j g
Reviews.Content: I have been in love with this hotel for well over 25 years. It's just a magical place that transcends not only time but a sense of emotional serenity. The very first time I stayed in this hotel I stayed in a very well appointed suite, with balconies, a living room, and I was in love. For this stay I was in a well appointed room, with an overall feel of room and comfort, but it wasn't the room I was staying there for, but for the hotel itself. You walk through the doors and you know immediately that you will be well taken care of. I had just left my Drs office, and was several hours early for check in, but honestly, there was no way that I could have gone to a restaurant or walked the streets with my face looking as it did at the moment. I needed a little down time before heading anywhere and they were gracious enough to allow me to check in early. (thank you) I quickly headed to my room and I was not disappointed with it at all. Yes, there were a few minor dings on the furniture, but realistically you cannot expect any hotel to replace furniture each and every time a hotel guest who has been careless checks out. And they were minor. While the bathroom was smaller than I would have preferred I still loved it and felt that it displayed good taste with a se se of warmth. The mini bar was well stocked with higher end beverages, which my palette sincerely appreciated, and I loved being able to lounge in one of the two robes provided while having an afternoon cocktail as I hid for a while in my room waiting for my face to go down a bit and enjoyed the view out of my large window. Once the swelling subsided a bit I excitedly made reservations at Feinsteins, and went walking to some of my favorite stores, Barneys, Bloomingdales and so forth that were all within walking distance. Truly my only disappointments with my stay was Feinsteins and The Library. Feinsteins, as I did not feel it portrayed a true level of elegance that one would expect from the Regency, and it lacked an overall feel of comfort. My disappointment with the library did not come from it actually being disappointing, as it has been redone wonderfully, but I do so miss the old bar that once was there. It invited mingling, good conversation, and wonderful music. Now it is more electronics, and seating only at tables, but it is still lovely and still home to the power breakfast crowd. Would I return tfo this NYC icon, rich with history? In a heartbeat and I plan on staying there upon my return follow up with my Doctor as afterwards I again want to be pampered.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: dmarie250
Reviews.Content: My husband and I received a two-night stay at the Loews Regency as a wedding gift to be used on Valentine's Day weekend. We checked in fairly late and were upgraded - our room was huge! It had a King Size bed, a seating/office area, a large bathroom with both a shower and a bathtub, a large closet and a kitchenette with a microwave, coffee maker and fridge. I have stayed at many hotels in and out of the city that do not have a refrigerator available so to me, this was a huge plus - especially if you are traveling with a family. The hotel is also in a great location just a few blocks from Central Park. Try to check out Dylan's Candy Bar if you're in the area too! We have been to New York hundreds of times, but had never been and we got some really great late night snacks! :) The only negative remarks about the hotel would be that the bell-hop grabbed our tiny weekend bag without asking and led us to the room. We had to tip him, when in reality we could have easily carried our own bag and found our way. If we had a lot of luggage, I wouldn't have minded. But it was a bit rude to yank our bag out of our hands. Also - another couple received the same gift for their wedding and they had a bottle of chilled champagne and snacks waiting in their room. I'm assuming that we should have also had this, but we did not. While I cannot comment on the value as it was a gift, I feel that if you are spending a few days in the city and want a luxurious, but home-feeling hotel - the Loews Regency would be it!

Reviews.Title: “horrible customer service if booking non directly”
Reviews.Author: michelle9580
Reviews.Content: so i booked through priceline to get room that will accomodate me, hubby, infant,and 7 yr old (leaving two at home as it's expensive to travel with all four)...... only to find out they put us in a room with two twin beds....yes twin beds. so i called the hotel to request the change(as priceline told me to do)....but they said they can't guarantee it so i called priceline and priceline called them and they said everything should be fine. i even contacted loews hotels directly through facebook and they assured me that i'll get a room with two doubles and a fridge(for meds and baby food).....i had a weird feeling today(a few days prior to the trip) so i called the hotel to verify everything. well rosa the manager said no we have twin beds for you and we marked that you may be able to get a kind room)...well i asked how that will accomodate us and she ended up putting me on hold for 20 minutes and then hanging up on me. WTF?!?!?! oh loews also had the nerve to tell me that next time i should book directly. if that's the case,then don't sell rooms to priceline!!!! i now don't know if we'll have a room that will acoomodate us. because rosa also had to mention that the double beds is about 200 bucks more a night!!!!! i'm frantic and nervous...nobody is returning my calls, priceline is refusing to refund me money...as loews too....so i'm basically screwed! DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL!!!!! it's worse than motel class.....definetely not a 4.5 star hotel!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “so far so good”
Reviews.Author: love2liveLARGE
Reviews.Content: Check in was easy.. they allowed me to check in at 11 when check in is 4.. large room with 2 baths.. a littel kitchenette and view of park ave.. so far its got hot water.. clean baths and no mold.. right off i noticed the curtains are sheer offering no black out fro sleep. but we'll see if its a bother.. staff is very friendly and they have starbucks in the lobby for free.. gotta like that!

Reviews.Title: “Park Avenue Perfection”
Reviews.Author: MelissaBG
Reviews.Content: There are many luxury hotels in Manhattan, but I chose this one for its location near my event. The Regency met every expectation for a property of this caliber: courteous doorman, elegant floral arrangment in the lobby, spotlessly clean, premium mattress, cozy bathrobe, boutique toiletries in the bathroom. What made it stand out was the size of our suite with two full bathrooms, and the polite, professional service, especially from the registration staff and concierge. A fun perk is the self-serve to-go coffee in the morning (hot chocolate in the afternoon). You can borrow an umbrella from the doorman if it looks like rain!

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated and welcoming!”
Reviews.Author: Kelliannb
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay! Cleanest rooms in NYC! Great staff! Very quiet, luxurious, and elegant. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families”
Reviews.Author: daniellemarie116
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the regency several times, having read that lowes hotels are known for being kid friendly. They certainly exceed their reputation in that regard. We stay in manhattan several times a year with our two boys, ages 6 and 9, and this is the only hotel we'll stay at with them. It's a beautiful hotel, the rooms are roomy and peaceful, quiet and very clean, and my sons are greeted upon arrival with a toy that makes them feel instantly welcome. Everything here is top notch, especially the doormen and the men who call cabs for you. Only cons are that because this is a top notch hotel, room service is very pricey, and the area is very residential upper east side, and it's a bit of a walk to everything. As far as Manhattan goes, my tastes run more downtown/village, (I lived and worked in the city for years so I know my way around), but with children, this is the place I feel most comfortable. And there's a great french bistro around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Family visit to NYC”
Reviews.Author: Tanya Christie W
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Loews Regency in December 2011. What a lovely experience! Our children had just turned 3 and 6, so we wanted to stay somewhere that would be child (and adult!) friendly. This hotel really managed to get that right. The rooms were quiet and comfortable, the staff was efficient and friendly, the kids were greeted by name every time we arrived or left the hotel, the doorman was always ready to assist us getting into and out of taxis with a stroller. The location is excellent. It really made our stay in New York such a pleasant one. We will definitely stay at this hotel again whether our children are travelling with us or not.

Reviews.Title: “home from home in nyc”
Reviews.Author: janetl_11
Reviews.Content: Just spent six days at this hotel with my husband. The staff were friendly and welcoming. The room was large with a small kitchen attached with a fridge and tea coffee, making facilities there was also a mini bar. Though as in all hotels the prices are scary so we brought in drinks and stored them in the fridge provided. The hotel has a homely family feel the concierge Kathleen was excellent and arranged trips and airport transportation for us. We had dinner in the library bar twice the food was excellent and reasonably priced. There is also an excellent gym and hair salon in the hotel. The location couldn't be better Central Park, Bloomingdales Barney's are all in easy walking distance. This is the second time I have stayed here and would return

Reviews.Title: “Girls weekend”
Reviews.Author: lmann1966
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful. Good location. The hotel was a little fancy for my liking, being an average person. I felt a little out of place. The staff was helpful. The room was clean.Bed and pillow were comfortable. There was a keurig coffee pot in the room. We used our Disney Vacation points to stay there, that was a good thing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & boutique hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Queen0fFun
Reviews.Content: I stayed here myself for the weekend. This boutique hotel is beautiful and perfectly located if you want to be in walking distance for shopping at Barney's, Bloomingdale's, and many many major designer stores. I loved that! I chose the location primarily because I was going to an engagement party which was at a venue two blocks away. The doormen, bellmen and concierge were all very helpful, day and night. When I called from my room to the concierge to ask for directions to Bloomingdale's he told me to come see him for a discount card at Bloomingdale's (15% off!). Bonus! Being a foreign visitor I would have only got 10% discount which I found out at the Bloomingdale's Visitor's center. I needed a pair of scissors late at night and the receptionist made an effort to get them from the gift shop. A bellman took my shopping bags and put them in my room during the day when I had to rush back out to get a taxi to a show. That's what I call service with a smile! The gym was perfect for this type of hotel; they have all the regular equipment with TVs, mats, weights, stretching bands etc....everything I needed to work out plus a sauna (which I didn't use); they even offered fruit in the gym and a bowl of red apples by the main elevators in the lobby...nice touch. (ended up being my breakfast since I was so busy!) I didn't spend too much time in my room but I did notice the following issues which were inconvenient: the makeup/shaving mirror in the bathroom is for a 6 ft tall person (I am only 5'2), as is the location of the safety deposit box in the closet (on top of a shelf), the bar fridge did not close with the key ( I realized that at 1:30 am and I did not want the Engineering guy to come to my room to fix it at that hour ...after the party!)and the cross lock on my door was missing a screw and was loose (had to have the "Engineering" guy come as soon as I arrived the first night to fix it-he was very prompt and friendly). Wi-Fi is available for FREE in the lobby but there is a $14.95 fee if you want it in your room. The bed was very comfortable. I liked that I could use their IPod dock and use it for an alarm clock. The NY times was delivered for free at your door each day. I didn't think there was a blow-dryer in the room until I noticed it on Sunday high up on a hook in a non-labeled canvas bag behind the bathroom door; there should be a note somewhere saying that it exists there! I did not eat at any of their restaurants or go to the Bar which looked very cozy and fun They have featured B list celebrities who sing there as a poster displayed in the lobby indicated so. Overall I liked it a lot despite these minor issues and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE STAY IN NYC”
Reviews.Author: charliechan007
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel, great staff, Front Desk people were very very nice, thank-you so much.

Reviews.Title: “Kid friendly, pet friendly and accomodating”
Reviews.Author: jian9898
Reviews.Content: The front staff are amazing! Although our room, booked months ahead was not ready due to water problems (this was for 3 nights at New Years) and we had a 3 hour wait, they gave us an upgrade to a suite for 1 night (we could have kept it for the 3 nights but did not really need a full suite) and they moved us to the room type we requested with a small fridge, microwave and extra sink on a higher floor with a beautiful view for the next 2 nights. We didn't even have to do the moving- they were so kind, and even sent milk and cookies for the kids the first night because of the delay. What a sweet surprise:) Beds in both rooms were very comfortable and clean. We loved the use of the bathrobes in the closet. Amenities in the bathroom such a Q tips and cotton balls were an added pleasure. The lounge had entertainment worth checking out prior to visiting because the events might sell out due to the entertainers they bring in. You might be best to book ahead. We went to the Metropolitan Opera which was an easy Taxi ride. Consierge was helpful with calling for dinner reservations for us, and answering our many questions! We were there for theater shows as well, and again, a taxi to the theater district is not expensive- $6-7 plus tip if you choose. New Years Eve the city was so safe that we walked all the way back from Times Square after midnight! Cudos to NYC! Walking to Central Park is a nice 3 blocks, and taking a horse and buggy ride thru the park is delightful! Go early for the ice skating to avoid long lines waiting- but it is fun and a larger rink. We will come back again when it is warmer and walk more place such as the Many, Many upscale shops nearby. Always remember when staying anywhere that kindness begets kindness, understanding begets understanding, and we live in this world together. We observed them maintaining composure and working to solve a small concern with an impatient customer who approached them with unacceptable rudeness. Now that is class!

Reviews.Title: “An old school classic”
Reviews.Author: just up and go
Reviews.Content: My entire family (including 5 kids) spent one night at the Loews Regency in January 2012. I selected this hotel primarily for the location, but also because it is touted as one of the most kid-friendly in NYC. As a YouFirst member, I also get a great rate. I was concerned by some of the reviews, and overall, I think that some are unduly harsh. Check-in was relatively smooth. We had 3 junior suites, which more than accomodated our party. Two were ready when we arrived at 12:30 pm, one was not. By the time we returned 4, the third room was ready. If there was any "disappointment", it was the fact that the front desk staff is supposed to acknowledge my "status" as a Loews loyalty program member, but they did not. They did, however, have small welcome gifts for the youngest of our group, ages 7 and 9. I would say that the door and bell staff were the friendliest, and that the front desk staff were a little cold. The lobby is one of the best places to people-watch. The other guests ranged from "normal" to incredibly well heeled. The kids loved seeing all of the dogs being paraded through the lobby - the hotel is very pet-friendly (though you would never know it in the rooms - not a hit of doggy odor anywhere). I don't know what anyone is talking about when they criticize the hallways - our rooms were on different floors and they were all immaculate. The rooms were large by NYC standards. The bathrooms were slightly larger than some I've had in New York. They were all marble, and fixtures were in good working order. My shower had great water pressure and I had no problems with the temperature. All three junior suites were slightly worn around the edges, but nothing too bad. A hint of rust in the bathroom, some slightly peeling paint - really, just simple wear and tear. The rooms were immaculate. Our rooms faced the "courtyard", as it were - really just the other buildings on the block, but I have to say, they were nice and quiet. Everyone said they slept well and loved how quiet the rooms were. We did not eat at the hotel - too many people, and we wanted to go out and experience the area. Also we did not use the fitness or other facilities. The location was perfect for us - two blocks from the park, seconds from the best shopping and local restaurants. Everyone commented that they loved the neighborhood feel. The consensus of our group was that the hotel was great - perfect location, clean, comfortable rooms. I travel to NYC several times a year for work and for fun and I would not hesitate to stay here again. This is a classic, old-school New York gem that reminds one of the old days, when travel had an air of glamour about it.

Reviews.Title: “poor service, overcharged me and 6 colleagues and they shrank my sweater with no compensation or APOLOGY!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CarolinePLondon
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Loews many times for business - and we are a big corporate customer - so they don't care about the companies paying to keep them in business. The service was so poor, they shrank my favourite jumper and they tried to rip me and ALL my work colleagues off by adding various random items our bills after we left. I last stayed in November and it was gotten materially worse since previous visits. The front desk staff are rude aloof and unwelcoming: everything is too much trouble. I am entitled to free wifi in the room .. but they don't tell you the code at the desk?. They shrank my favourite cashmere sweater and they didn't apologize or compensate me because I was not prepared to leave it with them [I live in the UK]. When I returned I was charged on three separate times on my credit card ... so confusing and all extra charges - 6 members of my team stayed too and every single one of them was also overcharged for food, the key to the drinks cabinet [minewas not even a cabinet .. the frdige was just sitting out in my room and kept me awake all night] and various other items. Trying to sort this out was another trauma: the front desk phone is never answered, the call centre is in somewhere in the south in the US and they couldn't understand my accent so it took me another 4 telephone calls to get the bill sorted. Something is seriously wrong with this venture which seems to be rotten in every aspect. I will never go back, I will never recommend it and will never forgive them for shrinking a $300 cashmere jumper and refusing to do anything about it.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting wouldnt even give it a 2 star”
Reviews.Author: Lee G
Reviews.Content: This hotel is disgusting dirty moldy stinking hotel that is in need of a overhaul the bathrooms are the worst so disappointed even the staff are not friendly one bit.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location...”
Reviews.Author: Leawooddoc
Reviews.Content: Always have liked this hotel, and have had about six previous stays, but seemed to not be operating on all cylinders as in the past.. We were a little to close to the elevator, and although we complained on second day, we never heard anything further, and we were there for six nights. There is a loud bell every time hat elevator comes to floor.Hotel is also getting somewhat shabby chic for a facility that books itself as luxury, with prices to match.We had mold on the ceiling of our shower, which the staff attempted to remove at our request, and there was caulking coming off from around tiles. Paint was peeling, and wallpaper coming off.Bedding is very comfortable. Facility is very clean, and housekeeping reliable. But, would have liked a turndown service in the evening,with usual mint on pillow. Location is VERY convenient and quiet, and near to theatre, restaurants, subways, and taxi availability.

Reviews.Title: “Loews Regency Midtown Manhattan Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShelbyTwp
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff (Hussien) managed to find us a room early in the morning. The concierge chef Kathleen Nugent was especially helpful with directions and helped with the sights we had scheduled. The room was large even by luxury hotel standards. The food in the restaurant was top quality and priced to match. The location was perfect 61st. & Park Ave. close to the theatre district as well as all the other midtown attractions. Very easy to find a cab and close to the subway in addition when returning to the hotel all the cab drivers knew where the hotel was by name. In short, a very good hotel, in an very good location.

Reviews.Title: “First Class with attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: NAFTAflyer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. OK - The Loew's staff are efficient and accommodating. My flight landed early and they found me a room early. Concierge was great. Room was comfortable and had good internet. OK - so the hotel is doing some retrofitting - it was not a problem. Perhaps this is not the glam -- but it is reliable with good service. The location is exceptional and the Regency Bar is classy with good food. This is a great spot. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “A little tired but Impeccable service makes this gem still sparkle!”
Reviews.Author: stevereviews
Reviews.Content: I used to be a Regency regular from the mid-90s 'til about 2001 so I couldn't wait to return nearly a decade later to see what, if anything had changed. Some recent snotty reviews on Trip Advisor had me worried. I was relieved to discover that many of my favorite room service and bell staff are still working at the hotel, a sign that The Regency must be a good place to work - having a content and stable staff is paramount to creating a hotel experience that feels like home... The lobby and gym are every bit as nice as I'd remembered and while I did see the same scuff marks that several guests have complained about, I really didn't mind that the room looked a bit tired and worn. I'd liken it to visiting NYC and staying with your favorite old, monied yet slightly hip uncle - sure, things aren't going to be totally brand new, but that's part of the charm. And just like that favorite uncle, the staff welcome you with a smile and a welcome back - I was surprised that even the male room service operator remembered me and asked how I'd been doing (even though we haven't talked in at least 7 or 8 years!) From the front desk staff to the maids, the impeccable staff makes this place a winner... And if you don't mind lots of Texans with giant fur coats on the elevator this time of year, The Regency will no doubt leave you with a smile. The one disappointment was that they've somehow changed the receipe of their once renowned crab cakes to the point that they were inedible on the room service menu. And I don't understand how they feel like it's okay to charge more than $20 for a bowl of berries for breakfast! That said, everything else I ordered was perfect and delivered in a prompt and courteous way. I look forward to my next trip... it feels like you're seeing old friends and family when you walk through the doors of the Loews Regency Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is nice, but the rooms are in need of a renovation”
Reviews.Author: BarbBoston
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old and has very little personality. This was our second stay. The rooms are a bit anemic. The carpet is light and, thus, appears dirty due to the spots. The furniture has dents and everything is frayed. The bottom sheets are not fitted, so they do not stay tucked in. Our room had a view of Park Avenue. This is supposed to be a plus, but that means it is near the elevator and the service area and, thus, it is very noisy all day and into the evening The front desk personnel are cold and non-responsive. One of the elevators was out of service, the hotel was full and as a result there was a long wait for a ride. Unlike many first class hotels, the bell people went up and did not allow the guests to go first. The location is ideal if you want to be on the upper east side. That is one of the best features of the hotel. The gym is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: lelempz
Reviews.Content: The room is very nice size, but the hotel was a little noises. the roomcleaners were very very nice,but the people in the reception donÂ´t. the others time iÂ´ve stay in the hotel the staff were more polite.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need”
Reviews.Author: pamelaornstein
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight at the Loewe's Regency so that we could go to Feinsteins, the cabaret in the hotel to see Bebe Neuwirth. Well, she was amazaing, and the hotel was very pleasant. The reception is a little crowded, but we really liked the library where one can sit, eat or just relax until 1 am. It has a wonderful atmosphere and we felt it was quite unusual and special. The room was very pleasant, the bathroom perfectly adequate, and the complimentary soaps etc are lovely with a fresh citrus fragrance....I really don't like the smell of a lot of these products, but this time they were great. We were on the 3rd floor, the closet was huge, and I liked the beige, and white scheme, with framed photos in black and white of white roses. Very handsome.

Reviews.Title: “Uneventful, Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: ALP1991
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Loews NY on November 10th. I was on the 4th floor and was pleasantly surprised at how quiet the room was. Also, the water pressure in the shower was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Our spacious home in NYC”
Reviews.Author: onlyGeorgeVwilldo
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights in room 725, a one bedroom suite overlooking 61st street. I was once in a tiny room in NYC and hated the cramped space. For me the spacious suites are a big plus and I come back to this hotel time after time. Our suite measured 1050sft or 98sqm (!) had two full bathrooms, 6 closets for all our shopping, a small kitchen and a large living room for unwinding after a busy day. We had room service breakfast on the large round table that was in one corner. It really felt like an apartment rather than a hotel. It is true that the rooms are not brand new and furniture shows blemishes sometimes, but they have also a certain charm that you won't find in a designer/boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Always nice to come back!”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Bang
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at Loews Regency. This time was special, because we were celebrating our 25 years wedding anniversary. When we came back to our room after dinner, there was proscecco, strawberries, cheese and a nice note from the director waiting. A very nice gesture! Yes, the rooms can need renovating. But the location is perfect, the staff is wonderful, the rooms are big and we think this hotel is really charming. We usually go to New York once a year, and we will for sure be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “In serious need of an update”
Reviews.Author: lesliec17
Reviews.Content: I'm sorry to rate this stay as a poor because there were many great things about this hotel. We received a very good rate for a king 1 bedroom suite. The space was amazing with a ful kitchen, 2 full bathrooms and tons of closet space. The view was fantastic. The lobby was very beautiful. The room size was fantastic. This is where the greatness ends. The rooms are very ugly and dated and are in need of a renovation. Everything above the lobby looks extremely tired. Adam at the front desk was extrememly helpful to me and accommodating. We had three people in our suite and for a few nights needed two cots which were very comfortable, we were not charged extra for this. The beds were very comfortable and if they get around to re decorating this hotel it will get an excellent review as the location can't be beat and I like that it is not a huge feeling mass hotel. We were given a credit for the state of the room however, I don't know what's taking them so long to update. I would stay again for the location but the rooms are depressing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for business and pleasure”
Reviews.Author: 1TNtraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really enjoyed staying at the Loews Regency. The location, a block from the southeast corner of Central Park, is excellent and saves a lot on walking versus locations we have stayed at on Lexington or near the United Nations. The room was very large for NYC with a nice work space, small dining table & 2 chairs, and a comfortable lounger. The big surprise is that it had a small kitchen with a sink, frig, and microwave! Our room was on the 10th floor facing 61st St. This worked out wonderful as we had almost no noise from outside ... no garbage trucks waking us at 5am or firetruck sirens at all hours. This hotel proved to be a real gem. The staff was friendly, but not overbearing or stuffy (this hotel is on Park Avenue, you know!). We also enjoyed the apples that are available as you step off the evelator. The outside of the hotel had scaffolding all around it during our visit, which made it a bit less appealing. In general our room was in very good condition. The bottom of the bathroom door was a bit weathered, but the showerhead was excellent and there was plenty of shelf space. For an upscale location (with an upscale price) I thought it was a little stingy to charge for internet access .... I took my laptop to a Starbucks and used theirs for free. Overall, I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice lobby and bar, room is tired”
Reviews.Author: mikedavis2008
Reviews.Content: My first trip to the hotel. It is ideally located for so many things. Service was great. Bar had a fun evening atmosphere. The restaurant is a destination, so they ask for reservations even at breakfast. Without one we were still seated. The room. Bed was comfortable, room was clean. Flat screen TV. Bottom of bathroom door was chipped, dirty. The inside rim of the sink was lined with mold and made using the sink less than desirable for $400+ a night. Charge for Internet in the room, free in the lobby. I went to the lobby; they do give free Starbucks coffee in the lobby, so some consolation. All in all, I still give this a 4.

Reviews.Title: “Very good New York Option”
Reviews.Author: PJW22
Reviews.Content: I usually struggle to find a hotel in New York that I enjoy. The Regency is very well located on Park Avenue. It is a smallish hotel and therefore it has a much more intimate feel than most hotels in this class. Rooms are surprisingly large although bathrooms are a bit small. My son's room had a small kitchenette which I did not really understand but my wife and I appreciated the combined tea and coffee maker in our room. Room rates are competitive. The staff are pleasant and helpful. My only small niggle is that it seemed to take rather a long time on two occasions for the waiter to take our orders in the otherwise pleasant bar. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “All is Quiet on Park Avenue!”
Reviews.Author: ltphoto97
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 09/23/2011-09/26/2011. We were there the weekend that the United Nations were meeting so the security to get into the hotel was pretty much like getting screened to board a plane (metal detectors, x-ray machine, etc.) I got the impression that there were several important dignitaries staying at the hotel because the security was so tight. Needless to say my husband and I felt very safe and secure in this hotel. I must start off by saying how upscale and QUIET this hotel was! Iâ€™ve never stayed at a quieter hotel, and being in NYC during a very busy political weekend I expected to hear some noise, however we slept in each day and were not waken up by any noise coming from the hotel or the city streets. In addition, the staff was friendly and quickly checked us in upon arrival. In fact, they even let us check in early (10:00 am). Our room was 419 and although it was near the elevators, we found the room to be extremely quite. The size of the room was nice. We had a king bed and plenty of space in the closet. I will admit that the bathroom was rather small, but considering that we were NYC I donâ€™t think that was too much of a big deal. I found the room to be clean and I had no issues with housekeeping. The location of the hotel is perfect for those of you who want to shop along 5th Ave. It was perfect walking distance to many shops and we were about 2 blocks away from Central Park. It was one of the nicest hotels that Iâ€™ve stayed at in a long time. I would recommend this hotel for couples, as it is a bit pricey and may not appeal to families. All in all we had a wonderful stay and canâ€™t wait to go back to NYC. I would recommend this hotel to others and would have no hesitations to stay at it again.

Reviews.Title: “Uptown Elegance”
Reviews.Author: cj878
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel literally moments before departing for New York and paid full freight, and then some, after all the city taxes are piled on. I would rather not be paying retail; nonetheless, I felt the hotel fully delivered on its star level and offered an elegant refuge in the center of Manhattan. The lobby and hotel rooms are very much in the understated, traditional style of Manhattan luxury hotels. The bed was supremely comfortable and the room very quiet in spite of the hotel's central location. The bathroom was spacious, clean, and in excellent condition. The Loew's Regency is a good option for travelers who want an uptown location. The hotel is situated in the heart of Manhattan's prime shopping territory and close to many restaurants and attractions. It is also a very walkable neighborhood. I did not use many of the hotel's services, so I don't have much to add on about the other aspects of the hotel's services. I did not encounter any of the "attitude" problems noted by some reviewers, but found the front desk staff and doormen/bellmen quite helpful and even congenial. As a former (and eventually returning) New Yorker, I frequently go back to New York for short visits, and found this hotel offered an excellent immersion in the uptown experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Default859
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel choice. Clean, comfortable and fairly helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel feel”
Reviews.Author: Hewesema
Reviews.Content: I just had a very pleasant experience at the Regency on Park Ave. The room was quite large for a NYC hotel and even had a small kitchenette with a fridge and microwave. The bath is tiny and could benefit from a convex shower rod so you can take a shower without flooding the bathroom. But the room is very clean and bright. The whole hotel has a small hotel European feel. The lobby is small and comfortable. The bar/library/restaurant is delightful. We ate one meal there and the waiter remembered our name when we came in the next day. Food is quite good but you choke on NY prices ($82 for breakfast for two before tip). Front desk staff is excellent and there are enough people so you don't have the wait that you experience in larger hotels these days. Location is perfect. Unfortunately... I was there during the UN General Assembly and the Israeli delegation was staying at the Regency. Security was insane with airport level security, limited elevator access and Secret Service agents everywhere you looked. But the staff handled everything with good humor. Tip: if you take a cab to the hotel, don't say "Loews", say "The Regency". The new name does not seem to have caught on.

Reviews.Title: “Great Address For Frequent Manhattan Visitors”
Reviews.Author: mke60
Reviews.Content: If this is your first trip to Manhattan and you're coming in to see some shows and do the classic tourist itinerary, you may want to stay near Times Square to fulfill your stereo type NYC stay experience. After you've stayed there once, you will appreciate this location all the more. When you stay here, you feel a part of the Upper East Side neighborhood and get a totally different feel for the city. You will likely find neighbors that have stopped into the restaurant for a meal or a drink while out on their nightly stroll and you can strike up a conversation. It's the kind of place you want to find and stay loyal to as your home away from home on every visit to NYC. My sense is that there is low staff turnover and if you stay frequently you will be recognized by everyone from the doorman to the maids and treated well. This property exudes understated elegance consistent with the address. Not flashy or lavish, but tasteful. At certain times there are promotions or deals - make sure to check. If you're lucky enough to get one, jump on it. Otherwise, expect to pay New York prices consistent with the address both in room rates and at the bar and restaurant- but no surprises there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service, could use some renovation”
Reviews.Author: Traveltheworld57_10
Reviews.Content: I was upgraded to a suite which was nice on the part of management. The location is excellent, the service is great but the rooms and bathrooms are dated and in need of upgrading.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: christylynne
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel through Priceline and we were looking forward to our 4 night stay with them. Great location for us to get around by foot as we were taking the train in from Toronto. No problems with checking in and room was spacious and clean. Our problems started when our train was cancelled for our return trip on Mon Aug 29 due to the "hurricane". My husband and I went to the front desk to explain the situation...we were basically stranded and could we extend the stay until Tuesday. Sure no problem we were told but the rate would be $429 for the night. So with taxes it would be almost $500. REALLY what with the situation and all you think they would have been somewhat sympathetic and at least charged us the rate we had on the previous nights even $100 more than that rate would have been alright. We asked to speak to the Manager who was understanding but it was the powers that be that were telling him that he was not allowed to give discounts...yeah right. He offered to give us his lowest rate so since we had no other choice we accepted and went out to salvage what we could of our holiday. When we returned we found out his "best rate" was only $20 less. Considering the circumstances I think more could have been done even a free meal in their way way overpriced restaurant would have helped. We will not stay in a Loew's property again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service: Valet Lost/Parked-in Car and refused to assist”
Reviews.Author: Mike R
Reviews.Content: Based on major service issues, we cannot recommend this hotel. SERVICE - 1 We base the rating largely on service and professionalism of the staff and valet during a stay from 4-5 September 2011. The valet took our car and keys at 6:00 PM. We returned to our room at 11:00 PM and found a message on our hotel phone with a time stamp of 9:30 PM stating that due to our roof rack, the hotel could not fit our car in their garage. (We also note that we parked the car with the rack with no issues in a number of other lots on the Upper East Side of Manhattan.) We made clear to the front desk that their request to remove the roof rack at 11:00 PM was unreasonable (as was a three and a half hour delay in even attempting to inform us of the issue and the fact that they only attempted to call us on our room phone when they had two cell phone numbers on file). The front desk personnel informed us that they would find a resolution to the issue or would call us back to inform us if they could not. We received no further contact from hotel staff until we checked out the following morning. After waiting over twenty minutes with no word from the valet, we approached him a second time asking about the status of our vehicle. He initially informed us that he could not find the vehicle. We found the vehicle parked-in down the street from the hotel. (As a former New York and Chicago resident, I am quite comfortable with parallel parking, but the car could not be moved without risking damage to it or the surrounding cars.) While refusing to assist, the valet further had the audacity to claim that we ought to be â€œthankfulâ€� that his morning crew had moved the car from an illegally spot that his own night crew had parked it the night before. The manager provided no assistance and informed us that, while she was â€œsorryâ€� she â€œcould not help.â€� The entire experience was unacceptable. When handing over a car for valet parking, we expect the hotel valet to assume responsibility for parking the car. If they cannot do so, we expect contact within a reasonable period (i.e. sooner than three and a half hours). We remained in our room for two hours after check-in and could have easily resolved any issues in that period, though asking us to do so by either removing the rack or moving the car to another garage at 11:00 PM was unacceptable. We also expect that, when informed by the hotel staff that they will â€œresolveâ€� an issue, resolution does not entail parking us into a spot we cannot get out of on a city street and refusing to assist in retrieval. Based on this experience, we will not stay at another Lowesâ€™ hotel and cannot recommend them to others. SERVICE-2 Besides the inept valet staff that allowed our car to be parked-in and refused to offer further assistance, service was generally fine. The one exception was the hotel bar and restaurant, where we waited over fifteen minutes to be seated, then left after waiting another twenty-minutes to see our waiter. (Only five other tables were occupied at the time.) FURNISHINGS AND CLEANLINESS The hotel was generally clean. The furnishings were fine, though there sometimes worn condition makes claims of â€œluxuryâ€� questionable. LOCATION The location was great for anyone interested in activities on the Upper East Side. The rates are relatively low for the location, though we have found better rates for comparable furnishings in the past. We cannot recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel/Bring Your Wallet”
Reviews.Author: gerimsw
Reviews.Content: This is a very beautiful hotel and we stayed here for a wedding that was in NYC. We paid for a King Suite, which I thought would be a lot bigger, but only the bed was bigger - that was a let down. Considering that we paid a small fortune to stay at this "luxurious" hotel, I thought that some of the amenities would come complimentary, such as wi-fi. This was an inaccurate guess on my part. Wi-fi services were approximately $15 per day. I think this is rediculous. Even in the business center, you have to swipe your credit card before using their internet services. We did order room service once during our stay - we ordered pancakes - the total cost was $26 - that was without the tip. And although the service was good, the pancakes weren't. I have to say that if I was going to stay in NYC again, I am tempted to stay at a lower cost hotel and probably have the same type of service. As for their parking, it cost $60 per day and if you want to take your car out and bring it back in, it costs another $60 for the same day. Needless to say, we parked our car on Friday and picked it up on Sunday - for a total parking fee of $160 plus taxes.

Reviews.Title: “Old and noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: orimarc
Reviews.Content: Stayed three night this August. Had a junior suit. Had to switch three times because all junior suites are too noisy. They do not say anything about it in their web page. Joanna at front desk helped us a lot and she managed to give as a nice room facing Park Ave. No noise at all. If you want to go to this hotel, make sure you are given a room facing Park Ave. ll of them, it seems, have double windows, so no noise.

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of room and nice amenities”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler54946
Reviews.Content: A large room with premium coffee maker, flat screen tv and an alarm clock with Ipod docking station, plus warm terry lined robes. The view out the room sized window was not particulary nice, but in the city, what can you expect? I did not find the mattress on my bed very comfortable and did not sleep well as a result. There were four extra large bath towels in the bathroom which was more than adequate, but the maid did not change out the wet towels and rehung them which was not pleasant as we didn't know which towel belonged to whom and they were still wet when we returned to our room at 9 p.m! Also, we blew a breaker when we both tried to dry our hair at the same time. There didn't seem to be enough outlets in the room for our personal appliances. The next night at 10:30 the maid knocked on our door and asked if we needed anything. I don't know what was up with that - we were already in our pajamas. Breakfast in the hotel dining room was expensive beyond belief.

Reviews.Title: “Needs an update”
Reviews.Author: elizss
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here over the years and if you look at pictures that the travelers took you can see how the hotel has many worn down doors, furniture and just tired looking edges. I don't know if the hotel has a renovation coming soon, but it is definitely becoming dated. The concierge was great, and the front desk helpful. If they could renovate the hallways and rooms, it would be up to the standards of the past.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, on Park Avenue”
Reviews.Author: Lane H
Reviews.Content: The Loews Regency Hotel in New York City, is an excellent hotel, in the upper east side. The service is almost comparable to a 5-star hotel, as they commanded to your every need. We had just arrived from a red-eye, and we just wanted to get to our room, and the person who checked us in upgraded us to a Junior Suite, with 2 bathrooms! The room is what you would expect from a 4-star, nice, but not luxury. But the best part of it all, was the location. I sat right at the bottom of the Upper East Side, on park avenue, close to everything. All in all one of the best Hotels I've stayed at in New York.

Reviews.Title: “We had a terrific stay here and would definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: bostonterrier
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel using our Disney Vacation Club Points, and I was a little nervous about our stay based on some of the reviews. I shouldn't have worried--it was all just fine. We had prompt and friendly check-in, our bags were stored without a problem so we could do a little sight seeing, and when we returned and got up to our room all was well. The elevator was nice and fast, so there was almost no wait time coming or going. The room was very spacious (great for our family of 4), clean and comfortable, with a flat screen tv, new carpet, and great linens on the bed. There was a mini bar, plus a kitchenette (Keurig coffeemaker with several teas, coffees and hot chocolate, microwave and mini fridge) and a large and sparkling clean bathroom. The room also had a small walk in closet with two plush robes, ironing board and iron. You can eat breakfast in the restaurant (which we didn't) but there is complimentary fresh fruit and coffee available, which came in handy. We were sightseeing most of the time and only at our hotel basically to sleep, but anytime we needed service from the hotel, it was attended to promptly and professionally. The library bar is a delightful place to wind down after a busy day in NYC--with its comfy couches, great service and snack menu, it's perfect! Also, I needed to ship something back home, and the concierge made it happen, no problems. The hotel is in a great location---an easy walk to Central Park (check out Sarabeth's Kitchen on Central Park South for brunch--delicious) and in the other direction, to Bloomingdales and the other great shopping on 5th Avenue. I would definitely return to this hotel and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Campervicky
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights and will definitely be back. The rooms were large and comfortable, the showers fantastic. Super efficient air conditioning in a heatwave breaking all records. But what made this special was the quality of the staff, particularly the maids who were so friendly in their morning and evening greetings.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is wonderful; Room Service/Cafe Food GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: 2PhDs
Reviews.Content: We've been staying at the Regency for many years, for business trips alone, business trips together, short vacations together, and meeting friends flying in from out of town. The service here is very efficient and friendly, a bit more so than some other large/business type hotels in NYC. The room service meals are very good (the scrambled eggs are remarkably "tender", although that might seem like an odd term to use). If you have a chance to eat in the "Library" (the Cafe-type restaurant), try Joan's Salad, a salad with unusually good dressing, and a LARGE portion of freshly grilled salmon. The taste combination is amazing. (This is a full meal, or a great starter if shared.) Many of the rooms used to have kitchens, which were very nice for those leftovers from various fine restaurants in NYC. The renovations a few years ago changed that space into suprisingly large and luxurious marble bathrooms, with huge glass showers ;-) To the best of our knowledge, these rooms tend to be on the LEFT SIDE as one walks down the main hallway (sorry; I forget how the room number go). These rooms are usually also a bit larger. => It's worth asking for them, although they cost more. (One note: in some rooms, these glass walls leave the toilet peculiarly exposed in a much larger bathroom.) The location is great: On Park Avenue, a bit quieter than some of the busier streets, but just a block or two from the shopping on Madison or Fifth Avenue. (The Fifth Avenue shopping area starts about 3 blocks south of the cross street, but the Madison shops and restaurants are just around the corner.) NOTE: Rooms can often be found for considerably less money using the discount online reservation services (not the hotel itself). You might get one of the smaller rooms, but you're in the same great hotel, same service, same location, sometimes for *much* less!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent luxury level hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelDelaware
Reviews.Content: Great spot along Central Park. The hotel rooms are roomy and very comfortable. There is an excellent fitness center, restaurant and lounge. I would avoid food service if you are on a budget. That being said, the food quality and service are excellent. The staff, concierge, and housekeeping are some of the best I have encountered. Kudos to all.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay there again - excellent for business travellers..and for runners”
Reviews.Author: Traveller11111111
Reviews.Content: I have stayed a couple of times now in the Loews Regency when I come to NY for business. Unlike other hotels in this price category that Loews offers spacy rooms. Sleeping experience is first class - very comfortable beds and no noise whatsoever. I usually start my day with a run in Central Park and as the Loews is 2 blocks away from the park, it is in an ideal location. Check out and check in is very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of New York”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTrvlr00
Reviews.Content: You cannot ask for a better location, good food, nice buzz and genuine staff. Love hanging out in the Library off the lobby which is a great place to meet friends for a long afternoon or a quick snack. Have not tried the evening caberet, but nice that there is some 'old school' New York so close at hand. The staff is helpful and quick to sort out any snafu, theirs or yours. Just two things...please renovate the hotel. It is really shabby in the rooms and stuff is falling apart. How many times can you possibly shampoo a carpet? It ain't gettin' clean! Then they need to move into the 21st century and offer free wifi. If the HoJo's of world can do it, so can Loews.

Reviews.Title: “Okay...could be better - a review from a travel agent & Platinum member”
Reviews.Author: yourtravelchick
Reviews.Content: Just stayed this weekend in a luxury 1 brm suite with my husband, 9 yr old daughter & 20 month old son to celebrate my birthday. It was o-kay. Something was lacking in terms of Loews special service whcih made it just another hotel in NYC (which is known for average hotels). Overall we had a great time because we focused on the pluses rather than the cons. PLUSES: great location, easy walk to everything, we had a large suite which looked good, food was high quality, gym was efficient, room service/housekeeping/porter were very friendly. Quick response time on housekeeping requests. CONS: Check-in staff not warm & inviting but disinterested and insincere - going through the motions. Absolutely NO VIP greeting for Platinum. No prior email contact before arrival (customary with Platinum members), my email request sent earlier to concierge requesting a special amenity be sent to the room with a congratulations note was ignored & I had to make a 2nd request. It arrived (which was appreciated) but without the note for my child so she didn't realize it was something special for her. She was also given an infant's toy instead of age appropriate toy at check-in. Doors in the suite wouldn't close without major slamming (all warped), kichenette was great but had no supplies (no plates, silverwear so it couldn't be used)!!! Bathrooms did not offer any special suite toiletries as other Loews properties do. Turndown not provided on 1st night (even though it was requested), done on 2nd night but other than moving the pillow off the bed and turning the sheet back nothing else was done. Long wait down in the breakfast restaurant both mornings. Summer fun program for kids was not well thought out (all kids should get a prize - a lollipop would have been sufficient!!) so not worth promoting and not worth us coming back in time for (as my child had repeatedly told us all day that we had to back in time for the kids fun activities at 4pm). SUMMARY: As a fan of Loews Hotels, I love to stay in Loews because of the 'extra' service, attention to detail, fun factor, spoiling of my kids that Loews are renowned for giving but I didn't have that at the Loews Regency. As a platinum member, I got my complimentary suite upgrade which I greatly appreciated but not any VIP service. I did have a perfectly fine hotel with very nice food in the restaurant when I actually could get to a table. It was clean & efficient and if that is all you want then I highly recommend it but then the Hilton & Sheraton also gave me a decent stay for a fraction of the cost. Would I stay again - sure - but I wouldn't expect it to be more than a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, large rooms for NY, but very worn interior”
Reviews.Author: bXMi
Reviews.Content: I got a decent deal through Priceline on a four night stay in mid May. My overall feedback is that I would not stay here again unless I get a very good deal. It is not worth the standard rate of about $370 when booking through the hotel website. Location is excellent, only a a few blocks away from the subway, Central Park and 5th Avenue. My room had a view towards the back yard so I cannot comment on street noise. I did notice that the hotel is located next door to a church and that homeless people sleep outside of the church at night. No problems with them. My first impression of the room was good since it was quite large compared to the rooms I have had at Renaissance Parc 57 and W Midtown East. However I did notice that the interior is worn and dated. Mouldings all over the room and bathroom had dents and thick layers of painting. Not very stylish. I would be reluctant to say this hotel deserves 4,5 or even 4 stars. An issue with our room in particular, was the poor noise isolation to the hallway. We could hear the elevator beep every time the doors of the elevator opened and it was loud! I have little basis for evaluating service, but the little contact we had with the staff was pleasant and they always made sure that there were enough umbrellas on the rainy days.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: larryderm
Reviews.Content: The Regency is a lovely hotel with excellent staff. The beds are comfortable, and the bathrooms well equipped. Now that the hotel is non-smoking, there is no longer the worry of being invaded by cigar smokers. The breakfasts are the original power breakfasts, where the staff and food are memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: GRJESQ
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Regency a number of times before, we were quite confident that we would have the same experience -- a luxurious, top-notch hotel in the finest neighborhood in NY. Well, the neighborhood hasn't changed - plenty of shopping, restaurants, and Central Park close by, but the hotel itself has sadly seen better days. From the lobby to the public spaces to the rooms themselves, the fit and finish were dated and worn. Our room, an executive suite, was large enough, but with small bathrooms (the door was rotted out on the bottom) and average accouterments. The room was drab and the paint was chipped, the refrigerator blew hot air and one coffee table had large discoloring rings in the finish. Disappointing after previous good experiences here.

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty Towers in Manhattan!!”
Reviews.Author: njabbott
Reviews.Content: The main problem with this hotel is the supercilious, indolent staff especially management. We waited for over 2 hours in the lobby after the advertised check-in time for our room to be ready with not so much as a drink or an apology. Eventually, I insisted that the duty manager get off her backside and check our room did we find that it had been ready for some time. The room reeked of cigarettes, obviously not caused by a single guest. The staff denied that it smelled and were adamant that it was a non-smoking room and apparently we were imagining the smell. Eventually a bellhop admitted, off the record, that until recently it had been a smoking room and that the furniture had not been changed or cleaned. We stayed for 3 days and I can't recall a single friendly greeting from the staff except for this single bellhop. The positives: he location is OK - some Manhattan sights are close while others are further away, our suite was very spacious and we saw Henry Winkler in the lobby

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Clarke25
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel and could not praise the service we received highly enough. In particular, we would like to thank Craig Kind, the Front of House Manager, for his excellent care and attention. We were upgraded to a beautiful suite which made our stay all the more enjoyable. Every memeber of staff was most pleasant and obliging. We would highly recommend this hotel and would certainly hope to return there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, Run-Down Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Worldtourist33
Reviews.Content: Checked in 5/12/2011. We asked if we could get a room with a view, but that request was ignored. Room 1105 was not a welcoming sight. The bathroom door was rotting and very hard to close from the warping. Mold issues on the marble tiles and the toilet was stained, very unsanitary look. Room was furnished with old carpet and furniture. Our "View" was not exactly what you would expect in a Park Ave Hotel. In my opinion, this hotel is run-down, needs updating, way overpriced and the front desk staff have never heard of customer service. Book a different hotel if you're going to New York.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed in a classic hotel”
Reviews.Author: stlouistraveller
Reviews.Content: We didn't expect the best room in the house because we used our Disney Concierge points to book. But we were surprised that the Regency had such an awful room. Dated furniture and old bath with dirty molding and tile. I am a Loews Silver Rewards member - but this is not up to the usual Loews I'm accustomed to.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, the most comfortable beds, doormen surly to the point of being rude”
Reviews.Author: JaneHH
Reviews.Content: I've just spent a week at the Loews Regency (booked via expedia on a secret saver deal). The Upper East Side location was exactly what I was looking for: close to Central Park and far away from the tourist haunts of midtown. The location of the hotel gives visitors the opportunity to experience the real NY (albeit from a priviledged upper east sider perspective!). If you stay here, walk the neighbourhood - explore the side streets, do Lex, 3rd, 2nd etc - you will get a better feel for what living in NY is all about. Other guests were of various ages and nationalities, lots of families, it was clear that there were lots of repeat visitors who see the Loews Regency as their 'home' in NY. Transport options were good - plentiful taxis, subways on Lex or 5th, or buses. My room was spotlessly clean, albeit slightly dated. The room was at the rear of the hotel, so although there was no view, there was also no traffic noise. However, the plumbing was pretty noisy - I was very aware when guests in the room next to or above mine ran showers/baths. The bed was one of the most comfortable I've ever slept in. I didn't eat in the hotel as I wanted to try out the restaurants on 3rd or Lex - there is a great variety, to suit every budget. The housekeeping staff were lovely, nothing was too much trouble. Concierge were also helpful and knowledgeable. Mohammed, who took my bags up to my room on arrival, gave me recommendations for movies and got me a cab for my departure was an absolute star. Doormen are the ultimate ambassadors for every hotel, setting the scene for the guest experience. Given that I spent seven nights at the hotel, and passed through the lobby three or more times a day, it would have been nice, had the doormen acknowledged me from time to time. My experience of them wasn't positive and I found them surly to the point of rudeness. They let the hotel down. Conclusion: great location and an overall positive experience, but some of the staff could benefit from coaching on how their attitude affects the guest experience.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in the Upper East Side”
Reviews.Author: Traveltheworld57_10
Reviews.Content: We usually stay in a king room but upgraded to a large king room. The extra $40 for the larger room and bath was well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Rudest check-in experience in 30 years of travel”
Reviews.Author: PortCreditVillage
Reviews.Content: My sister and I booked 4 nights at the Loews Regency Hotel for our annual NYC getaway. We booked a twin-bedded room through Expedia. When we checked in at 3:30 p.m., we were informed that the hotel was sold out of twin-bedded rooms and so were assigned a room with a king bed. I love my sister, but draw the line at sharing a bed. No amount of pointing out that we had taken the time and trouble to book, and had confirmation for, a twin-bedded room, made any difference to the check-in clerk. In fact, she pointed out that booking through Expedia didn't guarantee we would be assigned the requested room type. The best she would offer was a rollaway in the room and a move to a different room the next day. A call to Expedia resolved the situation - a twin-bedded room was miraculously available to us. This was not a great start to our vacation. I don't expect to have to argue about room type upon check-in. I haven't encountered this level of rudeness in thirty years of business and leisure travel across five continents. And, based on my experience at other Loews hotels, this customer service isn't up to their standard . The hotel is in a great location. The rooms definitely need freshening - especially in the bathrooms - but were clean and comfortable. If the check-in experience hadn't been so unpleasant, we would have been happy with the value for the price, especially given the excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Corgiguy
Reviews.Content: We were quite pleased with our 2 night stay at this luxury hotel. Also stayed at the dated Parker Meridien but the Loews Regency is much superior in my opinion. Please note that we had an amazing online bargain rate at the Loews, and in addition, the hotel clerk upgraded our room to a bigger one the second night. Pro: Very clean rooms with nice furniture and attention to detail Friendly and helpful staff Good safe location - walking distance to restaurants, shopping and tourist sites. Very comfortable high quality bed and bedding Very nice bathroom (though not huge) with lots of marble. Larger size flatscreen tv Lovely cosy lobby Fair sized hotel room for NYC Classy but friendly atmosphere Doorman Cons: Pricey (unless you have an excellent discount rate). All-in-all a very positive experience for us!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for better service or location”
Reviews.Author: Hamilton121
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at this hotel, the first having been in 2005. I went with my husband for a long-weekend break to see friends and relax. The hotel greatly added to our enjoyment of the trip. From the moment we arrived and were greeted by a charming porter and efficient Reception staff, so it continued. We had a Luxury King Room which was located facing 61st Street, this a a perfect location as it is far quieter than Park Avenue. The room was immaculate and spacious with 2 walk-in wardrobes! The room was always cleaned and tidied unobtrusively without endless trolleys outside the door. We only ate breakfast in the hotel but there was an extensive menu available and the food was of a very high quality. It is however not 'cost effective' so I would recommend eating out at a local cafe of which there are many. In essence it is brilliantly situated, good facilities and the staff do their very best to ensure your stay is utterly stress free.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: OhioTravelerZ
Reviews.Content: Hotel was fantastic, in a great neighborhood. Staff was friendly and accomodating. Rooms were big and nice for NY. Lounge was great. All in all, I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location! Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: sraybon
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th annual Christmas shopping trip in NYC. After reading other Regency reviews I was a bit hesitant, but we scored a great price on a room for 4 nights. My mother, 10 year old daughter and I had a fabulous time. I found the hotel staff helpful, rooms clean and spacious (comfortably fit a roll-away for my daughter), and the location could not have been better. My one complaint would have been the hotel bar. A bit small and hard to get a seat. The hotel staff told us about a wonderful italian restaurant (Seraphina?) directly around the corner from the hotel and we had our "night-caps" there. We've paid just as much (and more) for far smaller rooms in NYC. We were steps from Central Park and The Plaza and would stay at Regency again in a hearbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service"”
Reviews.Author: Jones4Traveling
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect hotel for spending a couple of days doing some Upper East Side activities rather than the usual Time Square stay. The hotel is nice, the service is wonderful (we were upgraded without asking, we were greeted by name later that evening), and the location is ideal for enjoying Central Park. I was a little disappointed in the rooms--a bit dated (though spacious for NYC). The rate was a bit of a splurge for us so I would have expected the room to be pristine. It's showing its age. But I would not hesitate to stay there again. Loved the Library Bar--lots of character.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home”
Reviews.Author: BiancaPhilly
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the Thanksgiving weekend - We traveled from Philly. We chose this hotel because we wanted to bring our dog with us. The hotel was great! Of course they we're friendly and receptive to our dog, as all Loews are - they were also ideally located close to Central Park, so we could easily take her out for walks. This also made it very convenient for us to take in the Thanksgiving Day Parade. So - great location. Also, great comfort. Our room was spacious and comfortable. The candy maker on staff provided decadent sweets each evening. The concierge was helpful. And the restaurant was an easy and delightful last minute choice for Thanksgiving dinner. I would definitely come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service in a dated building”
Reviews.Author: Traveltheworld57_10
Reviews.Content: Loew's Regency needs updating of the rooms and bathrooms. The location and service are great. There are not enough plugs to handle my laptop, smart phone and my wife's smart phone. The bathroom is right out of the 1960's and is small.

Reviews.Title: “Never Let's You Down”
Reviews.Author: louiebmayer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a number of times nad it doesn't get any better than this. I am partial to the Upper East Side anyway. Close to Everything a Great Place. Clean Nice rooms and a Heavenly Bed. This is truly a gem in NYC the prices could be a little lower for all the competion in the area, although it really is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like second class citizen on priceline booking - smoking room”
Reviews.Author: sofiehunt
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel after 6PM. When I checked in, I handed them my Priceline confirmation which clealry said "Deluxe non-smoking room". I was told they were fully booked and that all they had left was a smoking room. The comment was made that "you have a priceline reservation and they do not guarantee non-smoking rroms". They explained that priceline reservation is "if available". They offered no other options and basically said if this does not work for me they will help find another hotel. The hallway and room smelt terrible and the room was the same. As a non-smoker, I had difficulty sleeping and it was unacceptable that they did not find me another room. I would suspect if I had a "non-priceline reservatiom" they would have gone out of their way to move me to another room. I attempted to give the hotel another try last week and they would not honor the $275 price I originally got on Priceline. Lesson to everyone - don't stay at this hotel because you could end up with a smoking room even if you have a reservation that says otherwise. I stay in NYC 6-8 nights a month and I will not be staying at the Lowes again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury for all - teen, mom and dog!”
Reviews.Author: muttger
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our dog for two nights in July. We were pleasantly surprised by how spacious the rooms were and how graciously our dog was treated as a guest. The rooms were very comfortable as were the beds. Definitely luxurious. The location was excellent and we would definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but hotel lacking overall”
Reviews.Author: LAcurlgurl
Reviews.Content: I suppose there is a different standard in New York City, but I still cannot get over paying $300/night for a room no nicer than a Hilton Garden Inn room. The room itself was somewhat spacious (by NY standards), however the bathroom was really not adequate for this level of hotel. It was TINY, 1 small sink, small tub with narrow curtains, and no vent!! Which means that every shower steamed up the entire room, making it difficult to get ready in essentially a steam room. It seems absurd that my husband and I had to carefully time getting ready because of the venting and space issues. The good news about this hotel was the bed was very comfortable, housekeeping services were great, and the location was fabulous. I would not stay here again unless the price was significantly lower.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Location”
Reviews.Author: Lei430
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our 3 night stay at the Loews Regency - no complaints whatsoever. Room was clean, service was efficient, and location was excellent. Great stores nearby, a short walk to Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Very Beautiful !!!”
Reviews.Author: KevinTi68
Reviews.Content: this hotel is extra super good !!! it is located on the park avenue, on the 61st street. close to the downtown, close to the park !! the hotel rooms are so roomy and so comfy, looking at a amazing view !! simply perfect!! visit it !!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Worth Hotel in the 5 Stars category in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: NICECalifornia
Reviews.Content: What a nightmare my last stay at the Loews Regency was... I called 2 days before arriving to make sure I'll get a room away from the street & a high floor as I cannot sleep with noise. When I checked in, they gave me a room on the second floor, right on Park Ave with a broken window... I couldn't sleep all night. They just said they were sold out & that was my only option. Following morning, I never got the wake up called that I asked the night before... They gave me a different room for the second night but another guest walked in my room as I was getting out of the shower... The hotel gave that same room to someone else... What did I get for the trouble ? "Sorry"... That's it nothing else :( If you have to go to these area, stay at the Central Park Ritz Carlton or Essex House. Both hotels are similar & with much better service. Also, the rooms are not as nice but the Parker Meridien does a great job to make sure all guests are happy during there stays...

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lavelle
Reviews.Content: stayed in the Lowes Regency for three nights -- great hotel, staff very friendly and helpful. Great position, not far from Central Park. Would highly recommend this hotel to any traveller

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: bergenpolymers
Reviews.Content: My 11 yo daughter and I stayed one night at the Loews Regency in late August. We did an exchange through my Disney Time Share. We stayed in the King Executive Suite on the 12th floor of this beautiful hotel. The room was extremely clean and very large. We had 2 full bathrooms, a King bed and a large living room area. The service was very friendly and very helpful. Of course it NYC, so the cost to park was ridiculous and the hotel food was on the pricey side. The location on Park Avenue was about 2 miles from the Times Square/Theatre district, close to the 5th Avenue shops and Central Park. Overall, wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay”
Reviews.Author: Karim007_10
Reviews.Content: Average hotel expensive tough for what it worth. No Free WIFI!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Polished”
Reviews.Author: andromeda23
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at the Loew's for one night, but will definitely consider staying here again when in NY next. Our room (a large king) was very comfortable and had a nice view. It was mildly worn, but the building and room had lots of charming details. Staff were professional and the location is a quick walk to lots of restaurants and activities.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: rosespok
Reviews.Content: Had a very bad experience at the Loews in New Orleans..but the staff there handled the situation very well. Gave me two free nights at the Loews in New York. Beautiful hotel..excellent service. Love New York.

Reviews.Title: “garage sale furniture, hour wait for ice”
Reviews.Author: kellyanne1234
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed at Loews Regency for a three night stay at the end of a college visit trip. We have visited the city 4 times and love all the hotels where we have been guests. Our favorite hotel in NYC so far has been the Waldorf, but being curious, we like to see vist new hotels, hence our stay here at the Loews Regency. The location is quiet, and safe, but for Broadway shows and mainstram tourism, it is a little off the beaten path. Obviously, not a fault of the hotel....HOWEVER... We booked a junior suite, with a bedroom a queen pull out sofa and one and a half baths. Perfect for my husband and I and two daughters, right? When we pulled out the sofa bed, I was shocked that a 4 star hotel would allow anything like that on the property! The head of the bed touched the floor and the bottom stuck high up in the air. It was like one of those anti-gravity machines they sell for lots of money, but my kids just wanted to sleep, not stand on their heads all night! It also looked like something people would put out at a garage sale, and eventually have to put to the curb, because no one would pay for it. Again, not expecting the Plaza, but this is a 4 star hotel. We called and asked to be moved, but apparently the hotel was full, and they brought in two roll away beds which made it impossible to move in the small room and it got a bit ridiculous and we all got the giggles one night with my husband and family jumping all over the beds to get around. There are no ice machines in the hallways. You have to call room service for ice, which is fine, however the first night the coveted ice took 20 minutes to arrive, and the second night, took close to an hour. If you stay at Loews, please anticipate being thirsty an hour before you actually are, and call accordingly. New York was amazing as ever despite the blip from Loews. Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: tigerlily129
Reviews.Content: I traveled here with my Mom in mid-July for a long weekend for some relaxation and shopping. Location- it was perfect for a weekend of relaxing and shopping!
