We ate everynight within blocks of our hotel- both at Seraphina (yum!) and Tao. Also, its a VERY short walk to Bloomingdales and the stores around there. Plus, quick walk to Saks and Rockerfeller Center. Park Avenue is very quiet so there was no noise from the traffic which made it easy to sleep. Room- the room was fairly large. We had two double beds (the bedding was just okay- not great). There was a separate little mini-kitchen and a sitting area with plenty of room for us to spread out our luggage. The bathroom was okay, no counterspace was my main concern there! Would be nice if there was more counterspace or if they had a portable make-up mirror to help you get ready. Hotel- the lobby was nice, but small. They had complimentary snacks and beverages which was nice. The hotel bar was AWESOME. Great atmosphere, drinks and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: saopaulo36
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located, two blocks from Central Park. And that is it! Nothing else is worth mentioning. The service is very unkind, exception made to the ladies that clean the room. Concierge, bell men and Reception staff are not kind at all. Very rude and unpolite. I stayed in a bad smelling and stinky floor (the 3rd floor) in a suite that has a very small and old bathroom. Nobody asked me not even once if I was satisfied with the service. I definitely do not recomend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Central Location 3rd Choice Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: liptonst
Reviews.Content: Loews Regency Hotel stands out as unique in New York for me due to the clean, comfortable rooms, attentive staff, reasonable New York pricing offering great value. Situated in walking distance to Madison Avenue, Central park and the Empire State building if your a good walker. The rooms are free of noise pollution and are spacious but a little cluttered and with a closer inspection a little worn. The gym has minimal equipment, is very small, and will be busy. Management and Staff are always positive with a friendly presence and enough understanding to leave you to enjoy your experience on your own and confident to know when you need assistance, offering a great service from all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: abarasol
Reviews.Content: Great location....nice rooms for the price. Bar is outrageously expensive. even foe NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Just spent 3 nights. Dinah at the front...”
Reviews.Author: MarkMilburn
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights. Dinah at the front desk was extremely friendly and helpful. I had called to alert them that inhad made arrangements for a surprise wedding vow renewal with my wife in Central Park and Dinah arranged for an early check in for us. The room was great and the location was awesome. We will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: sonechko81
Reviews.Content: The room was great and overall hotel is nice with its fancy interior, but people who work there on the front desk need to learn some better customer service skills.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: unchilango
Reviews.Content: I'm a bit puzzled by the less-than-stellar reviews, because my week at the hotel was flawless. Very nice, spacious room that was comfortable, spotless and delightfully quiet. The beds are great. Employees were all friendly and helpful, and the location just steps from the park, FIfth Avenue and the UES was perfect. The only catch? The Regency isn't always affordable--I paid $331 per night plus taxes in May, but in October, when I'm back in New York, the rate jumps to $459. Sigh.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great staff”
Reviews.Author: ltomte
Reviews.Content: I spent three days with colleagues in this hotel (was not my first choice) but I would recommend it. The location is great, room service pretty fast and all extra needs (transportation booking, etc) addressed very fast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, would return to the Loews Regency”
Reviews.Author: klaine
Reviews.Content: Mt family and I went to NYC for a long weekend to celebrate my sister's Birthday. We had a great time - the hotel is close to Central Park, a 10 minute walk to the MoMa and a few blocks from Dylan's Candy Bar and Serendipity 3. We usually stay closer to the theatre district but since we didn't come to see any shows and had no desire to revisit Times Square on this trip, we decided to stay closer to the park and weren't disappointed. The rooms were nice, not dirty as stated in previous reviews. The staff was friendly and helpful (with the exception of one doorman) and we had a great time. I would not recommend the Library restaurant in the hotel, the food wasn't great and it was pricey. Try Norma's at La Parker Meridien for a great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but Snobby Staff won't go back”
Reviews.Author: PoorTripPlanner
Reviews.Content: Front Desk Staff (all three we encountered) were super snobby. The location of this hotel was good, but there are so many quality hotels in NYC that the location would not draw me back considering our experience with the staff. The room was fine. I t was clean. We had no view where we were, but I hadn't requested (nor paid extra for) that so I am not surprised. Here is another place where you can't put your own item in the minifridge without the sensors charging you for a bunch of stuff. Shouldn't their be a sign warning guests of this? I noticed a higher credit card charge than what was on the bill (after a week at home). But I wouldn't be surprised if many people don't even realize the difference. (10 - 20 dollar. I also had another odd ball charge that they couldn't explain the origin of. Both were removed without a problem from the accounting personnel I spoke with. All in all this is not the Loews experience I was hoping for.

Reviews.Title: “Facilities, service and location all excellent”
Reviews.Author: zzzusa
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Regency for a long weekend in New York. This is the third time I have stayed at this hotel in the last year and it is always a pleasure. The staff is very helpful and the rooms are quite nice and very large. The location is great. The neighborhood is quiet and very upscale and yet close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “I had a great stay at the Leow's Regency”
Reviews.Author: MAKay
Reviews.Content: I was treated very well by staff at this hotel. My room was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was a little tired and in need of a refurbishing, but clean. Location is superb. Concierge service was topnotch. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: sharkswimmer32
Reviews.Content: We stayed spring break of 2010. We arrived Monday morning at around ten oclock. We expected not to have a room, however we were given a room on the ninth floor. We had many requets such as early check in when we booked, which were all fufilled. The lobby was extremelly nice with free wifi which was extremelly helpful. The elevators were very quick and always empty. The room was spacious and nice but the bathroom was tiny. Our room was right next to the elevator, so our bathroom was smaller because there was a small locked closet thing behind our bathroom. Even though the bathroom was small it was very nice. The hotel is older bit still very nice. The housecleaning service came every day while we were out and turndown service was done most nights. When we checked in we requested a roll away bed which they said was $30 a day. The lady at the front desk however did not charge us. The first two nights the bed was this tiny little cot with a tiny matress. The cot was then replaced with a full sized rollaway without asking. We didn't really ever use the concierge but the one time we did to by there they were very helpful. We never used the fitness center, but walked by and is very nice and also free. We also got calls from the fitness center offering discounted masagges. The doormen are always outside and ready to help you with your bags or call a cab. The hotel is super close to central park and fifth avenue shopping. It is a 30 minute walk to time square and a 5 minute walk to the subway Overall the staff is very nice and helpful and the hotel is very nice and I would definetly reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DaveGC
Reviews.Content: Having read previous reviews we were a little apprehensive but I must say our stay was very good. We stayed for 4 nights. My wife and I in a twin suite. My 3 grown up daughters in a king. Arrival check in was good and we didn't experience the indifferent staff of previous guests. We had to request a roll away bed for our daughters room which we were told would be provided. The girls room was very large with a kitchenette and ours wasn't small either. Yes, they are a bit faded and in need of a spruce up but the location 2 blocks from Central Park is just great, quiet but convenient. We didn't touch the mini bar and 9 dollars for a bottle of water is extortionate. We had breakfast each morning from the coffee shop round the corner and ate it in Central Park as the weather was so good. I must admit we did not spend much time in the room only for sleeping really, but the beds were very comfortable. Only downside was the promised rollaway bed did not arrive the first night when we retuned late to the hotel. A complaint the next morning sorted the problem though. All in all a fantastic stay and would probably sty here again if we got the same deal.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons - More Cons - Wouldn't Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: gailkk
Reviews.Content: I took my husband to NYC as a birthday gift. I wanted to stay around Central Park South, because it seemed to be a great location in terms of proximity to good running and midtown attractions. I bid on Priceline using Name Your Own Price and got a nice deal on a room at Loews Regency. I figured it would be pretty nice; overall pretty decent reviews and a 4-star rating. There were nice things about our stay, but I'd say that the negative aspects of the hotel outweighed the good things. First, the good: - the room was BIG by NYC standards, probably 550 or 600 square feet. It was nice. - the fitness facilities are fantastic - we were just a block or so from the 4/5/6 subway line, which we used multiple times daily throughout our stay; very convenient - I'm not sure if all hotels do this, but I enjoyed receiving the New York Times at my door every morning (I read it at home too) Now the bad: - we checked into our room, and after a long flight and half a day of sightseeing prior to check-in, I wanted a shower. I enter the shower to find a 3/4 used bar of soap and someone else's hair in the shower. Disgusting. I call to the front desk, and they relocate us. They're polite but not really apologetic. And while I guess it's not a necessity, there was no sense on their part that they should do anything at all to make up for this horrible first impression. - both our initial room and the 2nd room had water damage in the bathroom; not a huge deal, but it was just off-putting

Reviews.Title: “Terrible staff and second rate laundry service”
Reviews.Author: walternmonic
Reviews.Content: The staff act as though they want to get rid of you as quickly as possible to go home, and who can blame them. I sent my shirt to be cleaned and pressed and it came back very well pressed indeed, but unfortunatley not clean at all. I think they pressed the shirt but forgot the whole cleaning process. This was my check out day and my flight was due in the morning so I had no time to ask them to correct this problem. They still charged me for a full cleaning and pressing service on checkout and my bill seemed very high considering I hadn't made use of any other of their services. In conclusion a rip off shop that wants your money with little or no service in return, and yes the rooms are ugly.

Reviews.Title: “OUR HOME AWAY FROM HOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: rom76
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel 3 times now. I LUV NYC and Regency is our Home Away from home. Our last visit was Sept 2009 for our 10 yr wedding anniversary. Hotel team was Incredible. Attentive and a BOttle of Champayne waiting for us in our room to celebrate. This hotel is away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square and 7th Avenue (BUT a short walk away) BUT it is in a glorious location - Park Avenue!!! 2 mins walk to Central Park. We are travelling to NYC again this year and The Regency is already booked. Room sizes are Fabulous, one of the biggest in New York. Dont go past this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Revisited in 2010: Regency became an inferior and unpleasent hotel”
Reviews.Author: mcvm
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately the excellently located Regency, that we loved, is not anymore what it used to be a few years ago. It became more a low cost and low level of service hotel. We just spent eight days at Regency, room 1014, 10th floor: and they have a crucial problem with the housekeeping service: dirty hallways, very poor cleaning in the room, every day half the room items was forgotten and every day we were obliged to phone asking for towels, bathmats, lamps burned etc. Every morning we were awakened by the shouting of employees, screaming in the hallway among themselves; During the stay we tried to contact the manager about it, by phone and sending e-mail, albeit never received response. In short, this was actually an unpleasant stay, certainly we will not return anymore to Lowes Regency.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Brotsy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is elegant and the staff is very attentive to your needs. The restaurant is lovely and the rooms are very well appointed. Great location close to Central Park and all that New York has to offer. Would stay here again in a heartbeat. The David Burke Townhouse on 61st Street has the best brunch around, just blocks from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel on Park Ave”
Reviews.Author: Graham23
Reviews.Content: I booked a trip to NYC for my girlfriend for Christmas 2009. I searched for months for the perfect hotel - The Loews Regency was the perfect hotel in every way! The rooms are huge and spacious. The bed is as huge and is as wide as it is long! The bathroom and shower were great. TV in bathroom is like something from the 80's but who watches TV in the bathroom when you have a huge Flatscreen in the main room! I wasn't overly amused with the view from the room - over looking other apartments. Aside from that the hotel was fantastic! The rooms were serviced twice daily inc a turndown service in the evening, which is the sign of a top notch hotel. Very clean and comfortable. The service of the staff is excellent especially the concierge who can tell you everything from which subway train to get to arranging tickets for a broadway show! When you leave the hotel, there is always someone to open the door for you and whistle down a taxi if you require one. Didn't have any food in the hotel as it was shockingly over priced! But the location is second to none. Just a 15 minute stroll to Times Square and 5 mins to central Park and 5th Avenue etc. This was our first trip to NYC and I was amazed by the whole experience. The hotel was out of this world and absolutely amazing but we were hardly in it to appreciate how good it was as we were constantly making the most of the 5 days we were in the city by doing a hell of a lot of sightseeing. We kind of only went there to sleep or get changed! I would highly recommend. For a special occassion I can also recommend visiting the Rotating sky bar for the evening on the 48th floor of the Marriott Marquis hotel on Times Square. Amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Rooms, 'eh' service”
Reviews.Author: brybread
Reviews.Content: SERVICE: Even though they were polite, I felt like they had some snobbery in their tone of voice and body language. Felt so urgh when I had a simple question for the concierge on where to go for a late night snack in the neighbourhood. Totally got some "Bit$h don't disturb me" vibe from him, while he was playing with his mobile. Doormen talking to themselves. Half the time, I had to open the doors by myself. Urgh CLEANLINESS: Cleaned daily, which is expected from a 4 star. Nothing more nothing less. ROOMS: Lovely rooms, well decorated in dark oaky furniture. Comfortable beds and bathrobes. Had a flat screen TV, but the shower pressure was inconsistent. Overall, nice hotel, has the potential of being better by providing better service to their guests. I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “seedy place in need of an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: lucysanchez32
Reviews.Content: Bathroom was in bad shape with peeling paint, and rotting wood. Paint on the wood of bedside table was peeling as well. The bed cover looked pretty ratty. However, the room was pretty large by NYC standards. Chicken noodle soup from room service arrived with no noodles. Terrible service from front desk staff. Had to wait for over 10 minutes at reception before my presence was even acknowledged - there was plenty of staff around at 9:30 pm to at lease say "hello - we'll be right with you." I had booked a Premium king but was put in a lower category room without an explanation. Only later when I called and asked what type of room i was in (deluxe) they admitted it was not what had been booked. There were no premium kings available, so they adjusted the rate. however, I don't think it would have happened if I had not checked - they would have just stuck me in a cheaper room and charged a higher rate. Upon checkout, I called down for help with bags. 10 minutes later, I called again and was told someone was on his way up. 10 minutes later I went down to check out, and found the bellman lounging against the reception desk. I asked again at which point he went up and brought down my bags. All in all, I felt like this place was run by people with no integrity and the overall experience was just plain seedy.

Reviews.Title: “Standards are lower than expected”
Reviews.Author: Teepey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived at the Loews Regency Hotel last Monday. Check-in was simple enough and we weren't waiting too long and first impressions were good. We were given a key for a room on the third floor and when we went inside our room the first thing that hit us was the overwhelming stench of cigarettes. Being non-smokers I called the front desk and told them that we could not possibly stay there. We had specifically requested a non-smoking room and so without much hassle we were moved to a lovely room on the 15th floor. We were very pleased with our lovely corner room and so we unpacked and freshened up, etc. Just then the phone rang. It was the front desk. We had to move, we were told, as there was a problem with the bathroom and they would need to have it fixed soon and therefore nobody could stay in it. For our inconvenience we were offered $100 voucher to use on food/drinks at the hotel and we were given a room on the 11th floor. It wasn't as nice as the one on floor 15 but it was fine. The bed was very comfortable, the towels and robes were good quality, the carpet in the room appeared very clean and so all in all we were happy. About 4 days into the stay I dropped my earring onto the floor and I needed to pull the nightstand out to find it. I was quite disgusted to see used tissue, clothing tags and a chocolate wrapper down behind there, left there by a previous guest(s). That was very disappointing, obviously the room had not been cleaned properly. It also made me wonder what other delights lurked beneath the bed and behind the other furniture. I did not want to look for fear of what I might find so I just tried to put it to the back of my mind as we had only 1 day left and lots of things to do. However, it did absolutely tarnish this hotel in my opinion. Inattentive staff, high prices and slow service I can just about handle but unclean rooms I have zero tolerance for and for that reason we will not be back and I won't be recommending it for that reason either. No way.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Salfordred_9
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on this hotel we were a bit dubious but it was already booked so we went with an open mind. We stayed for eight nights over christmas and new year. The welcome and check in procedure that we went through on arrival was very good and staff were friendly, contrary to previous reviews. We paid a very competitive rate on Expedia for a room with twin beds but were upgraded to a king bed without having to ask. One massive plus of the room was that it was very quiet considering it's in New York city. We had a room at the back of the hotel and this may have made the difference. This hotel isn't a 4 and a half star. The room was fine but the bathroom was quite shabby. If it had a refurbishment, it would be worthy of it's rating. However the housekeeping staff were brilliant and the room was cleaned and a turn down service done every day. It is in a great location and you can walk to plenty of the nearby attractions and it's 2 mins walk to Central Park. Overall this was definitely worth the money and is a great base for exploring. For nearby places to eat cheaply and for a good breakfast, head to Lexington Avenue near to 63rd Street. 'Eat here now' was a really good reasonably priced diner with an extensive menu.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: tori62
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 7 nights with my two children aged 6 and 8. I had a luxury king which was a great size and very clean. We had everything we needed. All the staff were great and helpful. I loved the location, very easy to get around and very safe.

Reviews.Title: “great price, nice hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: hwalk
Reviews.Content: for $225/night plus tax we had an excellent room - plenty of space, quiet, attentive housekeeping. The bathroom was a bit worn but otherwise the room was excellent value for NYC hotel over the xmas holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Once a gem, now a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: MercerMan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Regency for all of our NY trips for the past eight years. Initially, we were drawn to the Regency by its great customer service, well-appointed rooms, and safe location. We loved it so much that we called it our home away from home. Sadly, our last two stays here (12/08 and 12/09) have been less than stellar and we're afraid that this will be our last stay for a while (we're checking out today and moving to the Le Parker Merdien). Even as Loews Platinum members (the highest guest loyalty status), we have been treated with little regard (and at times, complete disregard) during our recent stays. Upon check-in this time around, we didn't receive so much as a "welcome" or "hello" - we were simply asked to hand over our credit card and then given our room key with no explanation of the room type or any type of hotel information. Unfortunately the rooms have gone on the decline as well. As an example, the furniture is very worn, the paint is peeling and bubbling, the toilet is not securely attached, and the bedside alarm and lamp do not even work. As the front desk had not explained the process by which to connect to the internet, we called down and received instruction over the phone. After many tries, we could still not connect at which point we called back downstairs. This time, they put us on hold for almost 15 minutes at which point the line went dead - we had been hung up on! Eventually, we got through to the hotel's IT manager (who was quite helpful) - he gave us the correct instructions to get online and it worked (mind you, these were different directions that the operator had given us earlier). Without going on an on, we want to reiterate that the Regency has been a magical place in the past and, while we're saddened at its recent state, we hope that they can get their act together. One huge positive that the hotel still has going for it is Mike the bellman. He has always been (and continues to be) the consummate professional and almost makes it worth staying here despite the other problems.

Reviews.Title: “Location, but only location, not the health club and not the rooms!”
Reviews.Author: FOL-1003
Reviews.Content: absolutely, the facilities are a bit worn out and the heath club is tiny, in the cellar, no windows, the Hotel is run for Cashflow, hard, very hard for cashflow, so yes, do not use the minibar, do not use roomservice. we paid an overpriced rate pre-christmas of 400usd and the ONLY reason to stay there is 'cause the hotel is 3oom from my office. i try something else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: AHLP27
Reviews.Content: We stayed with Loews hotel in November 2009 and booked a non-smoking twin room. On arrival we were given a smoking double room. When we pointed out the error we were told that the room type was not guaranteed and were given very little by way of apology. We were met with a similar response when the issue was raised again on check out. In addition to the poor service, the hotel looked very tired and was in need of refurbishment. The location is good but there are much better hotels in the area for a similar price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but needs a refurb”
Reviews.Author: j9999
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice this fall due to Loews First Benefits. Both times I stayed in a Suite. The suite was roomy with a queen size bed and little master bath and a sitting room with couch and powder room. The check in area is fancy enough. The staff was adequate (other than housekeeping issues which seems to be a product of recession and I'm find at other four and five star hotels..I guess this is where they cut back) Anyway, the rooms are old looking and need to be gutted. Bathroom shower clogged. Bathroom toilet running. Stains on carpets and couches. Not totally gross and it was clean but not worth the $500 plus rates this place gets. I've stayed at worse in NYC but I've also stayed in better, nicer looking rooms for less in NYC lately. A lot of the boutique hotels and many of the chains such as the New York Hilton and the Crown Plaza times square might not be as fancy but the rooms are cleaner and newer. Service was adequate. Love the heaters over the bell area outside so you don't freeze when waiting for a cab. Also, another note, I stay in hotels all of the time but the room service here may be the most expensive that I 've ever seen. Bring in food or walk around the corner to Lexington for a bite or you'll pay big. I'd stay here again as the location on the upper east side is great. The hotel was quiet and the bed comfy so sleeping was great. I'd only stay though if I could get a great rate as this fading property is no 4 or 5 star as it would like to be.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch business hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: HealeHouse
Reviews.Content: I have stayed several times at the Regency and am consistently impressed. The location is excellent at the borders of midtown and Upper East Side. The relatively small size of the hotel means it has a more convivial feel than larger and more impersonal luxury hotels. The breakfast room is excellent, populated mostly by local power-brokers. The fitness centre is definitely superior to most other hotel fitness centres, and again is used mostly by locals (with a personal trainer). Rooms could be larger, but that is a common complaint in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Smooth and well-appointed hotel on the Upper East Side”
Reviews.Author: Mrquixote
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in the UES, so unless you're into upscale condos, doctors or the a couple of the Museums there's not a lot going on up here. The subway is not as prevalent around here as it is in midtown and downtown or the UWS, so you may be cabbing it more than you planned. I suggest you tip the doormen graciously as they're a font of good info and you'll never wait more than a few seconds for a cab or car. Service is top-notch, as with all Loews Hotels. The lobby is surprisingly small, but rooms are decently-sized for NYC and dead-quiet. Try to get a room facing Park Ave. instead of the school or church on either side. The restaurant downstairs lays claim to the original "Power Breakfast" and it's not uncommon to see movers and shakers there. But it is pricey, and there are some great, cheap diners within a couple blocks walk. The adjacent nightclub is nice if you want a mellow evening of jazz crooners/piano bar with your drink. Traveling here with your pet is not only easy, it's encouraged. The pet-menu is creative and funny.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: welshwisdom
Reviews.Content: we had a fabulous stay at this hotel staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. We have to mention Abraham our concierge whom made the trip for us always attentive to our needs, always smiling and genuinely interested in our day. Abraham also recommended to us a great restaurante one of 'David Burke's fine restaurante's - specialising in contemporary american food. We would also recommend 'Nougatine Jean Georges for great french food. Overall we will definately be going back to New York an amazing City and we would be definately staying in the same hotel .

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL - NOT recommended”
Reviews.Author: EmilieBUR
Reviews.Content: Completely overpriced ! Hotel was overbooked when we arrived ! Receptionist was extremly unfriendly and no one apologised for the mistake. We got given a Smoking room whereas we specially requested a non smoking. The smell in the room was horrible !!! Room was dark and not that spacious ! Nothing like this would be expected for a $500/night hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fab stay at Loews, New york is a must. I can't wait to return, i'm busy saving”
Reviews.Author: SUZIEBABE21
Reviews.Content: Hi I stayed at the Loews Regency for four nights with my daughter. It was a great stay, lovely comfortable bed in a fab room, With everything and more expected. We were made very welcome and felt totaly safe. Good location for most of the sights. Could not ask for more. We did get a good deal through Thomas Cook and would probaly not been able to afford it other wise. Now I am hooked and want to return a.s.a.p. On our return we relised my daughter had left her watch in the room. This was reported by e-mail to the hotel as soon as we got back to the U.K and we were contacted by the security member of the hotel who imeadiatley returned in by post. A big thanks to The Loews Staff for that. Susan and Rachel

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic comfortable stay, however check your bill on checkout!”
Reviews.Author: Porkychop
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Loews Regency for 5 nights for our anniversary. We went to New York and to do the usual sight seeing. I have seen some bad reviews for this hotel, and believe from my experience that they are completely unwarranted. I agree it was expensive (Â£920 for 5 nights) but all hotels in NYC are, so decided I would push the boat out a bit for a nicer stay, and that is exactly what we got. Bear in mind that my wife and I are not rich, travel the world staying in 5 star hotels, or very fussy... but happy with a clean comfortable room. Check in was extremely quick and smooth, and staff were extremely helpful when we asked for directions, taxis or anything else that we requested. We stayed in the superior double room (cheapest on offer), and we thought the room was huge and very clean. The king size was bed was massive, and more comfortable than most beds that I have slept on in any hotel. The decor isn't new or contemporary but the room was clean, as was the spacious bathroom. All bathroom accessories were provided for such as shampoo, soap, body wash, and conditioner. A little dissappointing was the lack of free wifi in the room, but then I'm not on holiday to use the internet. Beside there is a very fast FREE wifi connection in the lobby. As a bit of a fitness freak, I was more than happy with the fitness facilities in the gym, which included a good selection of cardio equipment, as well as weights and gym mats. The walls in hotel are slightly too thin as you can hear noise from the corridors, but it isn't that bad. I thought the locaion was excellent, a couple of blocks from Central Park, a block away from the closest subway which goes straight to Times Square, Spring Street, Brooklyn Bridge. But to be honest you can pretty much walk everywhere from the hotel... approx 15mins to Times Sq. There are also loads of Cafes and restaurants in the area for good breakfasts or dinner. As for the bill... make sure you check it and get a copy when you leave. We never use the minibar at any hotel due to the extortionate prices. On checkout they tried to charge us for minibar usage, but could not tell us what it was we had drunk. When we said we did not use they minibar they assured us that the bill would be corrected. However on our return to England I found a charge of $7.04 on my card from the hotel, for drinking a can of coke from the minibar. It took four emails to the hotel to get the money back. As for NYC... it's a fantastic city for sightseeing, eating and shoppping. Subway is cheap and quick if you don't want to walk, but I wouldn't advise using it after 10pm. Have breakfast at Balthazar, and eat dinner at Public. Also if you want to get a good view... Rockerfeller is much better than the Empire State Building.

Reviews.Title: “Service, Professionalism, Amenities Lacking @ Loews Regency”
Reviews.Author: onethousandmiles
Reviews.Content: Service -Stayed for an extended weekend under two different reservations (booked the first two nights with a consolidator and the last night directly with Loews). Was told by reservation desk staff upon check-in that my party (my friend, his wife, and his young child plus my wife) would be "automatically" moved from the two rooms reserved with the consolidator to the two rooms reserved directly with Loews since the rooms reserved are of different classes. Check with the reservation desk on Monday @ 3PM and find-out that the new rooms are not ready yet. Go up to the old rooms and find that we have been locked-out. Go back to the reservation desk to get the key cards re-enabled. Go on a shopping trip and come back to the hotel at 5PM -- rooms still not ready. Ask to speak to the manager -- clerk goes to a room behind the reservation desk and comes back a few minutes later -- told person who has one of the new rooms has not checked-out yet -- after much back and forth "reassigned" a single room with two bedrooms. Professionalism â€“ A member of staff mistook my friendâ€™s wife as part of the hotelâ€™s housekeeping staff and admonished her for drinking the coffee that is made available in each guestâ€™s room. Amenities â€“ Furniture and baseboards shopworn; stain in one of the bedspreads; window left open and hard to close because of a bent metal frame plus many years of oxidation.

Reviews.Title: “"Luxury deals are available"”
Reviews.Author: MCBDurham
Reviews.Content: Contrary to some recent reports, I have little but praise for the Loews Regency Hotel NYC. I booked a 2 bedroom suite in January via Magellan Vacations, at a cost of USD 640.00 per night. The room was circa 1300 square feet, and included a guest washroom/WC, kitchen area, sitting room/dining room c/w 50" Plasma, two large bedrooms c/w 32" LCD's and an entrance lobby. The room allocated (728) was a corner location, with views down Park Av and 61st St. We arranged for airport transfer via Capricorn Limousines (aligned to the hotel) and the whole transfer experience was seamless. Check In was fast and professional, as was the delivery of our luggage. The location of the hotel, 2/3 blocks from Bloomingdales, Central park and 5th Avenue is perfect for those with only a few days to explore the city. In line with many NYC hotels, it is important to impose yourself at the offset. Generous tipping upon arrival invariably ensures a 'smoother' experience, and though not obligatory, is nevertheless expected in an establishment of this calibre. I have previously stayed at the Waldorf Towers and Parker Meridian, and both provide the same outcome. Our rooms were spotless, and the lemonade in the lobby a welcome relief in the heat of the day. A special thanks to Lisa for her kindness in making an unforgettable stay for the girls.

Reviews.Title: “Loews Regency: Getting Tired and Sad”
Reviews.Author: David St. Hubbins
Reviews.Content: I've been to the Loews Regency many times over the past decade and I'm sorry to report that it's not really the same hotel anymore. The feel of the hotel has changed: from a high-end hotel that catered to a well-traveled and probably demanding clientele (film people, business people, upper tier travelers, diplomats) to, well, a pricier tourist hotel that seems to be overrun with European and Australian tourists. And while you can put up with a snooty attitude when the rest of the hotel balances it out, when that balance doesn't exist, snooty pretty quickly turns into sneery, which leads to annoyance. Whereas the rooms used to be spotless, ours had a fairly large black stain on the floor. The beds were comfortable enough, but they're also starting to show their age--especially when you compare them to Westin's comfy beds, or the pillowtops that a lot of higher-end hotels have now. Other small things. The "do not disturb" sign was missing, as was the tag to hang on your door if you wanted breakfast. And what happened to my free shoe shine? Unfortunately, this seems to be business as usual for Loews. I used to stay at the Loews Santa Monica fairly often, until it too began to get run down and your fellow travelers were all excited about "seein' the movie and tee vee stars." Blech. Sorry Loews Regency. Give me a call when you renovate.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't very keen on this hotel at all.”
Reviews.Author: gizm0sm0m
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at 5 different hotels in New York City in my various visits there. This hotel ranks as my least favourite of the lot and it had the biggest star rating (4.5*). Right from the time I arrived I felt less than welcome. The room was not ready when we arrived, even though it was after 3pm. When we finally did check in, the last occupant's used old shampoo bottles and soap had not been removed upon our arrival. Yuck! The room itself was nothing spectacular, in fact, the bathroom was in rough shape, very dated and not particularly clean. The charges for room service and courtesy bar items were completely outrageous. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Britannic
Reviews.Content: Good location on Manhattans Upper East. Excellent room,very clean and comfortable. Friendly Doorstaff and Bellhop.not so friendly duty manager,checked in late so might have had a hard day,either way at these prices you expect service with a hint of a smile! Overall one of New Yorks nicer locations with a top dining experience to boot!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed 3 days - super pleasant experience with kids”
Reviews.Author: cbs1972
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in mid April. We had a great 2-bedroom family suite. The locations is superb for kids and shopping and the staff were very professional. Room service was excellent and overall it was great value for money. The decor is a bit dated but the rooms were quiet and very functional with kitchenette in the suites - very good if travelling with small children. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond expectations”
Reviews.Author: savtashira
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel. Everything was as described in the ads. The room was a good size with large well equipped bathroom, two closets, triple glazing, impeccable housekeeping (room was cleaned twice a day!), doormen who were always there to stop cabs and greet you, concierge who was truly helpful in any questions or suggestions. The slashed prices of the recession were truly the icing on the cake. A big bowl of fresh apples near the elevator was refreshing. Proximity to Central Park and great shopping was indeed a plus. The feeling that security in the hotel worked was quieting. This is definitely a place to recommend and return to.

Reviews.Title: “How To Handle A Problem”
Reviews.Author: rogets
Reviews.Content: We reserved a very comfortable and well-appointed 2-bedroom suite at the Park Avenue Loews Regency New York for a weekend beginning May 1, three nights at $793 a night. Virtually everything was to our expectation, and our 4-person party enjoyed their stay, particularly breakfast in the "Library", absolute joy. Several times we discussed returning again to use the same space. But everything changed Sunday evening. The adjoining suite erupted in an extremely noisy party, every shouted word of which filled the living room of our suite. We called Guest Services and said we could not use our living room and please have the party quieted down. Nothing happened. For the remainder of Sunday we abandoned the living room of the suite, as we had no choice but to confine ourselves to the most distant bedroom. The next morning, paying my $2600 bill at checkout, I went over it all again, and was assured that I would soon be contacted by Management. Subsequently the Front Desk Manager telephoned me with a very sincere apology, and volunteered an adjustment amount to my bill that clearly reflected that they took the situation very seriously. We'll go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it..snooty staff that act like they own Park Ave.!!”
Reviews.Author: steinhto
Reviews.Content: Im a pretty regular travelor and have been to many hotels in my day, and was very excited for my newborn's first trip to NYC and first hotel stay of his life! I searched out many hotels in NYC and was looking for a spacious, affordable, and kid-friendly hotel. Based on reviews, Loews seemed to be the best of all worlds, but I was quite surprised to find that the Regency, NYC lacked in all of those respects. First, the front desk staff was disinterested, aloof, and pretty much as snooty as Park Ave. itself. I asked for a room and they pushed for a kitchenette which would cost $40 more per night, and I said I didnt need one. Sure enough, they gave me a room w/ a kitchenette, but didnt charge me for it..bonus, but not sure what the deal was. I requested a crib upon arrival, and when I got there at 6:30pm, we were taken up to the room by an excellent bellman, but the crib wasnt there yet. When i asked the bellman if I should call downstairs to get it, he said that he was going to take care of it. When we returned from dinner around 10pm with my child sleeping in my arms, still no crib! We called downstairs and they finally came by 11:30 to assemble the crib, which took a half hour, while my child slept on our bed. Next, my room key deactivated twice and I couldn't get into the room, and you would think by the second time, they would have sincerely apologized, but the lady at the front desk barely looked me in the eye, let alone apologized. My wife ordered room service one night, and I know that NYC prices are up there, but she got a grilled cheese and a side salad, which came out to $58...come on! Lastly, the rooms were supposed to be spacious, by NYC standards, yet the bathroom was so tiny that my legs stuck out the door when I sat on the toilet and I hit my head twice on the mirror above the toilet, while knocking the toilet phone off the hook every time I entered the bathroom. So, in summation, crappy experience, staff that was unattentive and snooty..all around bad experience! I expected more of you , Loews!

Reviews.Title: “Bring your own laptop!”
Reviews.Author: llamaMamaMarinCounty
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Regency for a week in November so my husband could run the marathon. We have 3 small children and reserved a 2 bedroom suite. The rooms were well appointed with small kitchen and large living room--plenty of space and with just enough dings and scrapes on the woodwork and walls to make us feel like our kids wouldn't damage the place too much. We had excellent service from everyone...The real problem was computer access. We did not have our laptops and so had to use the business center: $1 a minute!!! With 2 people checking emails it gets expensive in a hurry. The hotel had wifi that we tried to access with our iPhones but you had to agree to similar rates--no thanks! We were paying a small fortune for the rooms and my husband had a fit that we had to pay that much for internet use. We would stay here again for the location and rooms but next time will bring our gadgets!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Families and Pet Owners”
Reviews.Author: Valkyries_Sin
Reviews.Content: Loew's is the perfect hotel for pets and families, so I have no idea why everyone keeps thinking they aren't. They guaranteed us connecting rooms for the simple fact that we have children. Feinstein's offers a magic show on Sundays and they looked after our little ones so we could have dinner alone for the evening. Not only that, but we brought our dog and it was only $25! Both our children and our dog receive welcome ammenities, and they did everything they could to make our stay company. I would strongly suggest becoming a Loew's YouFIrst member, as we got an upgrade upon arrival for being a member and a late check-out. Also you should most certainly book through MagellanVacations at NewYorkCityLuxuryHotels.com. They got us a phenomenal rate on our room and they also rebooked us at lower rates twice before our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location !”
Reviews.Author: MrsGMichael
Reviews.Content: Was worried about going to this hotel after reading a couple of reviews, but after arriving and checking in, felt very pleased with my choice. Staff very attentive and friendly We stayed in Room 505, didnt overlook Park Avenue but was the quietest hotel room I think I have ever stayed in, didnt hear anything ever. Housekeeping staff very nice, and did a good job in the room tidying up all my shopping bags for me. Only used the restaurant once for a late night snack, was very yummy, and quite pricey but no more pricey than the rest of NYC. Bar staff very chatty and friendly, nice atmosphere in the lounge bar area, just what you needed after a long day. Room was tidy, the bathroom was modern in the seventies, definately needs a new bathroom ! However saying that the shower was very powerful and the towels were very fluffy, it was just a bit old. Great location within easy walking distance of Central Park and some great shops, Bloomingdales 2 blocks away, but I prefered Macys which is a good 20 minute walk away, but can be done. Great italian restaurant around the corner called serofina. Breakfast we walked to the Wellington Hotel opposite park central and sat in a diner there for breakfast and there is the brooklyn diner opp Carnegie Hall, about 15 mins walk. And Im a slow walker. I dont think I would stay at this hotel again as I do like a nice bathroom !!!! But that is the only reason I would not go back here.

Reviews.Title: “Your home in NYC”
Reviews.Author: doctorlol
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the hotel before, we nearly made the mistake of trying another hotel, for a change. How pleased we were that we decided to stick with The Regency. We reserved a Park Avenue room, with more than ample space for tw persons, and indeed it could easily hold your two children as well! The position of the hotel is perfect if you want to be near most stores and museums, yet be in a calm neighbourhood. The staff, many who have been at the hotel for many years, are just so guest orientated that you might be in the Four Seasons, but 4S is just too big to be comfortable. Restaurants abound, and the subway is near. The only drawback is the current woeful value of the British Pound, makes NYC much more expensive than a year ago. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Classy but with flaws”
Reviews.Author: mergansertx
Reviews.Content: Why classy?? * Great location: * Just a couple of blocks from Central Park * Very close to the Metros which will get you anywhere you want to go * Staff was outstanding: always willing and able to take care of any needs. Very responsive. * Hotel room: * Room was quite large. * Bed was very comfortable * Kitchenette was nice plus Why flaws?? Given the price of the hotel, I would have expected 5+ star quality in all areas and it was good but not great. * Rooms are somewhat dated and could use some upgrading. * Bathroom plumbing: drains in sink and tub were very slow to drain. Had to finally call maintenance to come and work on them. They finally got them to flow. * Hallway carpet: hallway carpet on at least two of the floors seemed to be dirty. Certainly not up to the standard expected.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: lu2travel05
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, good size room. Loved the one cup coffee brewer. Bed was very comfortable. Staff helpful - helped us find a nearyby subway entrance and gave us a map and instructions for our first subway experience. Nice touch with the bowl of apples and lemonade stand in the lobby. Not very conveniently located for Broadway shows or Times Square area but great locatiion near Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “dirty stay”
Reviews.Author: traveller02115
Reviews.Content: I have traveled all over the world. I generally stay at Four Seasons and Ritz Carlton, and also have stayed in Westins. I was VERY disappointed at the NY location. We stayed at the suite. The hotel was very disappointingly dirty. I am not sure how they are able to manage a business with unacceptable cleanliness. I feel this situation is due to neglect of the management. The room carpets had so many stains. The play area in the breakfast restaurant had crumbs of food. Please clean your act. I own several businesses. I could understand the expenses involved in renovation, but we spent $1000 a night including taxes. If you need to command this price, please follow with a clean location. We almost checked out due to the cleanliness, but decided not to ruin our wedding anniversary. I generally would not write comments, but hopefully accept this as a constructive criticism. I will never stay in another Lowes Hotel due to this experience. We stayed in Room #725. The staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Indifferent service and tired accomodations”
Reviews.Author: JacksonNewportRI
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations, and most were not met. An indifferent front door staff -- we were ignored as we struggled to get luggage out of the taxi, as they stood by and watched, and NEVER ONCE in 3 days was a front door opened for us as we entered or left the hotel. The room (Superior King) was spacious, but with an itty-bitty, tiny bath. The rooms and hallways were old and tired, and all a bit dingy. IMPORTANT NOTE: the lack of sound proofing of the rooms was appalling - we could hear every word of the people speaking in the rooms adjacent to ours. The location is excellent, the prices high (the food and drinks were outrageous) and the overall experience more 3-star than 4 or 5-star.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Regency”
Reviews.Author: crfan
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a 3 night stay at this upper east side hotel over labor day weekend. Service was excellent and very helpful. King bed in standard room had excellent linens and room was very comfortable. Good work space provided. Beautiful setting on Park Terrace at 61st. Two block walk to Central Park was great for morning jogs. Quiet area with high end shopping one block over on Madison. Convenient for museums. Number of small cafes and bistros within 3 blocks for evening meals. The hotel's Library Bar is a great place to hang out or eat small meals (but very pricy). Found a great deal on the internet and hope to return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Good Service, Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: IJW79
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, friendly and good location. Rooms not overly luxurious but large and spacious. Great room service but VERY EXPENSIVE! ie $13 for a soft drink from the mini bar!!! $30 for a sandwich (but bloody tasty!!)

Reviews.Title: “Park Avenue Gem”
Reviews.Author: Equity
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Regency for three nights this past week. We love the location on Park Avenue and the neighborhood. Check in is extremely fast and there is an excellent door and front desk staff. Our room on the 10th floor was comfortable, spacious and very clean. The bed and pillows were comfy. Bathroom amenities were very good. Bathroom did not have a fan which is a minus. The hotel floors are quiet, elevators are prompt and housekeeping and turndown services superb. We had drinks in the bar one evening and at $21 per were overpriced even by NYC standards. Nice coffee makers in the room. This is a hotel we return to time after time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: travelbh
Reviews.Content: The friendliest staff I have ever met in a hotel. Welcoming, smiling, check in was a breeze, the room (suite) was excellent. Breakfast at the Regency is a great experience (make a reservation or you won't get in). A helpful concierge gave us lots of things to do. Give yourself a reason to stay there and then enjoy one fine experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed!”
Reviews.Author: trixie412
Reviews.Content: My sister and I usually stay at the Barclay Intercontinental when in New York, but it was booked and we found an affordable promotion through the hotel's web site. We were very impressed with the hotel and liked it much better than the Barclay for many reasons. Although the folks at the front desk were a little aloof, the rest of the staff was cheery, friendly and helpful, even the poor man who had to fix our toilet at 11:00 p.m.! We had requested a non-smoking room and got one, however it was clear the previous guest had smoked and so we requested another room. We were upgraded to a larger room right next door. Although the hallways were a little worn, the room was very well decorated and included a large flat-screen TV and Jonathan Adler pottery. Room service was extremely expensive so we opted to eat downstairs in The Library. Breakfast was yummy and, to top it off, there were bowls of M&Ms everywhere! It is a kid-friendly and pet-friendly hotel and even has a place for kids to play right next to the restaurant. If we can afford it we will definitely return to the Loews Regency.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: scoobyincuffs
Reviews.Content: We had a room with a king sized bed on the third floor. the view was of an elementary school next door. the room was on the small side for a hotel of this level, but had all of the amenitites. Soft, comfy sheets and great pillow. Plenty of towels and toiletries. My best friend and I traveled to NYC for a girls' weekend to sight see and go to a Broadway show. This hotel seems to be more for business than pleasure stays. The location is more high end residential and is a little out of the way for tourists. There are no late night eateries close by. I would not recommend this hotel for tourists on a tight schedule, due to the distance from tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice New York Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wallyQ
Reviews.Content: Enjoyable Stay at the Loews - Huge Luxury King Room - Very comfortable room - Nice Big Bed with Lots of pillows - Flat Panel TV - Bathroom Okey, kinda small - Big Work space - Service quality mixed. Doormen greet you by name, but Reception counter staff are generally aloof - Located on Park Avenue. Comfortable walk to 5th ave, Apple Store, Central Park, Rockefeller Center, even to Grand Central Station. - Quiet Part of midtown. - The Free Hot Chocolate during winter is very good and rich. Had a very nice enjoyable stay. Highly Recommended. It was much better than Sheraton Manhattan hotel. Got a great deal from Quikbook online. 2+1 night free.

Reviews.Title: “Loved staying here”
Reviews.Author: zoo-ma-goo
Reviews.Content: I really liked everything about this hotel. The rooms were fabulous and the service was terrific. A great location as well. I especially liked that it was a small hotel , The beds were very comfortable .

Reviews.Title: “Just decent and overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: pace_ripley
Reviews.Content: For the $500 or so I paid for the room I expected 'immaculate' and the Regency falls short of that. It is a very nice hotel at a great location but the check-in service was less than friendly. The room was large but odd shaped (a very long hall with 3 huge cabinets). The work area was not optimal, with no electrical outlets under the desk, but at a side wall that was not too close. Your $500 do not buy you free WiFi ($14.95) - but you can easily grab wireless connectivity from the airwaves in the area. The bathroom was clean but the fixtures a bit aged. The shower/bath in particular was cramped and the stream mediocre. Again, not up to snuff for the price. An odd story showing indifferent customer service: a colleague staying at the hotel with me walked into the room he was assigned after checking in only to find it occupied with a couple in the throes of passion. The front-desk's reaction: "We thought they had checked out already." That was at 9:00 PM. And that was all they had to say about it. Again, not what you'd expect from this class of hotel. If there were other places to stay during this conference-laden week in NYC, I would have tried them. Not a bad hotel at all, but for this amount of money, I would expect much more.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: JKS
Reviews.Content: Nice location on Upper East Side. Easy walk to Central Park and all it has to offer. Booked a 1 bedroom suite with 1.5 baths, kitchenette. Original room was light, bright, and had a small kitchenette, nice terrace facing Park Avenue and great windows, but only a single bathroom. My 12 y/o daughter, who had broken her ankle the week before our trip had a fit. We were moved to another 1 bedroom suite. This one was dark, not as spacious, in need of updating, no microwave, no coffee maker, but it did have 2 bathrooms, so my daughter was happy. The daytime doorman was superb and friendly. He quickly remembered our names and made friends with my 7 year old son. He went out of his way to accomodate us in and out of taxis, as we brought along a wheelchair for my daughter. The concierge was abrupt and not much help for kid-friendly dining options. Continental breakfast through room service was $29.00! Try Burger Heaven at Lexington and 62nd. Three of us had full breakfast with juice for $24.00 including tip! Service was wonderful and pleasant, and the food was decent. Would I stay there again, probably not, nor would I likely recommend it to a friend. There are other, better hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at The Regency”
Reviews.Author: akoser
Reviews.Content: I had another great stay at the The Regency the night of January 10, 2008. I booked a standard room for a short business trip and was upgraded upon check in to a 15th floor delxue king room as I am a gold member of the Loew's First loyalty program. Thr room was large by New York standards and there was no street noise at all in the room. I also received a complementary bottle of white wine in my room as per my Loews First profile. Much appreciated! The location of the hotel is excellent. Check in and check out were a breeze and my room was cleaned to perfection. The large flat panel TV was appreciated and the bed was exceedingly comfortable. I did not use the fitness center or dine through room service. Breakfast in the hotel restaurant was excellent and served quickly. All in all, this hotel consisently reminds me why I keep returning to The Regency.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in midtown”
Reviews.Author: VermontGolfer
Reviews.Content: In NYC on business and didn't want to stay downtown. Company travel agent suggested the Regency. The room was good size for NY and looked to be recently renovated. Large flat panel TV and a small desktop area made my stay. Bed linens were nice and the decor was modern, but not funky. Lobby bar/restaraunt was nice, but expensive. I didn't get a chance to walk around too much around there, but given the mid town location, I imagine you are a short cab ride from everything. All things considered, you get a good hotel for the rate.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect postiion”
Reviews.Author: Hale_Liverpool
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in a junior suite. The suite was not large but by New York standards was more that adequate. The position was perfect for fifth avenue and Bloomingdales. Also the subway station was really close. The staff were fantastic - so helpful and the complementary umberellas came in really usefull on the rainy day! We did not eat in the hotel because we wanted to try lots of places but the free coffee in the lobby each morning was nice. The gym was well equipt and we used it every morning (yes really!) We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loews Regency, sorry, not for me”
Reviews.Author: travelmaniacfreack
Reviews.Content: Good: Location/Neighborhood Service/Staff is perfect Bed & Pillows are #1 Limonade in lobby in the afternoon Quiet hotel Housekeeping and turndown services Bad: Old hotel, need a big major makeover Outdated room/Bathroom (2 tiles did fall down during shower) Small room/Bathroom with no ventilation Room service prices and xtra fee(21%fee + 5$ a guest)is a joke Way too expensive, you have much better hotel for same price or less (Sofitel hotel is still my favorite in NYC) Loews shoud put money in the hotel and stop thinking that the friendly employees will make up for the running down hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: blueswriter
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Hotel. 4 day weekender with two adults and three children (9-14). We stayed in a huge two room suite overlooking Park Ave. . 1100 sq. ft. with 3 closets and 1 1/2 baths, refrigerator and microwave. Sofa bed was useable but in poor shape, but the two rollaways the hotel provided were perfect for the kids. The room was on special discount via Leows hotels and offered best value I found in NYC--two small rooms at nearby Sheraton or Hilton would have cost more and provided half the space. The neighborhood is the perfect location for a nyc trip. Easy access via Park Ave. and great location to Central Park (2 blocks) & Bloomingdales, Madison & Fifth Ave. shopping all within easy walking distance of a few blocks. One block east to Lexington Ave (or two blocks east to Third Ave.) and there are a host of deli and supermarket choices, burger joints or fine dining--whatever you prefer. We visited the "top of the rock" for views of the city from the top of Rockefeller Center...The "Rock" is definitely a "tourist" destination, but if you like looking down on the city, the views are tremendous and there were no lines. The observation areas are very clean and the glass walls around the observation deck don't obstruct views like the screens/fences surrounding the Empire State Building. We also tried the circle-line double decker bus downtown tour. We picked up the bus at central park...just a few blocks from the hotel. The kids loved that as well...and they liked hopping off and back on a different bus at various stops. Two tour guides were great, one was a cynical jerk, but hey it's NYC and you never know what you're gonna get. The great thing about the buses is that you can hop off at any time. Cab rides even from downtown were never more than 10-12 dollars and there is easy access to the hotel. Subway entrances are also just a few blocks away. Regency Hotel went out of the way to make our stay enjoyable--they provided umbrellas from the doorman if it was raining. free coffee (delicious) in the lobby in a.m. and free lemonade in the afternoon. The housekeeping staff provided everything we needed right away. It's been a long time since I stayed in NYC and felt welcomed and not simply like I was being "processed" through the hotel system. The neighborhood also felt safe and clean. This will definitely be our hotel of choice for future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Dependable 4-star, Great location.”
Reviews.Author: MAVacationerBoston
Reviews.Content: We stay here about once or twice a year. Prices are generally competitive for New York- this time I paid just over $420 net per night. Rooms are clean and quiet, location couldn't be better, and if you join Loews First, you can generally get an upgrade to next larger/better room/suite. Restaurants are great for breakfast, lunch, dinner, and after dinner. But I usually want breakfast before they open. In that case, walk one block over (right out of hotel, right on 60th, right on Madison) and eat at Viande Coffee Shop. Fast basic food and they must open for business at dawn- I've never arrived "too early" for a quick hearty breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Adequate room”
Reviews.Author: lizrogatz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights and had a good experience. The staff was well trained, the location good and the room, although not special, met our needs. Nice location to get to shopping, but I would not recommend dining in the restaurant. I wanted a beverage one evening and got a mini can of diet coke for a whopping $7. The bowls of free M & M's almost made up for it...but not quite!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - very pet friendly”
Reviews.Author: amiprice
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Regency on business in April for four nights. My husband and small dog came along. Loews is great with pets. Our room was at the end of the hall, which is great when you have a pet and was very spacious. They provided dog bowls and treats and we were allowed to leave our dog in the room unattended. Our room was spotless, it is obvious that the hotel is very well maintained. Room service the three or four times we ordered it was delivered promptly and the food was of very high quality. There are three reasons that I give this hotel a 4 rather than a 5. First, it's pricey, even by New York standards. I believe our double room was $479 per night. Second, if you are scouting this hotel for tourism, the location is not supurb, it is somewhat far from the major tourist areas. It is, however, perfect for the Lex and Park area. Lastly, it's an older hotel and the soundproofing is not very good. It is a loud place, which is bothersome in the mornings if you are attempting to sleep in. Overall, I'd definitely return, mostly due to their wonderful treatment of pets.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: reajc50
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice place to stay! Just a couple of blocks from Madison Ave. and Central Park. 3 of us stayed in a suite which had a kitchenette, living room, king bedroom and 2 bathrooms, and plenty of closet space!!!! The room was clean and tastefully decorated. No clutter! The bathrooms were a little small but fine enough. The bedding was clean and very comfortable!!! the couch was cushy and comfy as was the cot they brought in for one of us. The extra blankets they brought in were soft and when we requested them, they had just come out of the dryeer and were warm:) The housekeeping cleaned up the bathrooms daily which was nice. The towels were clean(I've been to hotels where the towels were not!) Even though the mini bar was pricey, we still enjoyed some of it:) We didn't eat in the restaurant but did have lunch in the Library, which was nice, very tasty food! Room service was pricey, the food was good but nothing special. Your best bet would be to hit up a local grocery. The hotel staff including the housekeeping, maintenance and doormen were very friendly. We were on the 10th floor near the elevator which we did hear the noise from that, but it wasn't that bad and we had no problems getting to sleep after shopping all day!!! This is a pet friendly hotel and we noticed several guests had dogs, but we never heard any barking and the place didn't smell at all of pets. We plan to stay again because of the closeness to Madison Ave and because it was such a pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Regency aims to please!”
Reviews.Author: ESP36
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend at the Regency in NYC and it was a wonderful experience. I went with my significant other and my daughter. My goal was to book a hotel room that was comfortable with plenty of room for the three of us. We booked an Executive Suite and it worked out perfectly. This room had a king sized bed and french doors that opened to a second living area with a queen pull out sofa. It also had two bathrooms - I was nervous this would take away from the spacious living areas but they did not. The bathrooms themselves were small but had everything you could possibly need including great water pressure and the cleaning staff did an excellent job straightening up and replenishing everything. Their were plenty of drinks and snacks but we did not touch them as they were a bit pricey. I would definately stay at the Regency again. Overall the hotel was very clean and the staff went out of their way to make you feel comfortable, from the door man, folks at the front desk, room service, even the parking garage, it was a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite in NYC”
Reviews.Author: tatworthington
Reviews.Content: This hotel is my first choice in New York, although it is frequently full or very expensive. It is not the most luxurious in the city, or even close, but the rooms are comfortable and the staff is excellent. The food is very good, but forget about breakfast. It is a hotspot for breakfast meetings or when you want to 'accidentally' run into someone in the NY real estate scene, so the average hotel guest can't run down and grab a bite. However, there are excellent choices nearby. Don't forget to bring home some of the Hero Stars, if you have a dog.

Reviews.Title: “Our NYC base, for sure”
Reviews.Author: thepeacha
Reviews.Content: We have had some really unpleasant rooms in NYC and were hoping for a good experience here- and we got it! The hotel was lovely and very well situated for us; we got off our transatlantic flight and took a nice hot bath, felt great! We were given a lovely huge room on the 11th floor, but it was right next to the elevator and sounded like being above the subway- much too noisy for us. We went down and they could not have been nicer about exchanging, gave us the keys to 3 rooms and told us to pick. We selected room 630 facing Park Avenue, even bigger than the first, with a small hidden kitchen facility- perfect for keeping drinks cold or snacks handy. I could not have been more pleased. I am super sensitive about smoke scents and I did not get a whiff, I was worried about what a prior reviewer noted. NYC is certainly expensive for hotels but this one was a gem, excellent value for the price. Loved the bedding and the staff, the nice view along Park and deep bathtub. My only nit-picks would have to be the in the bathroom- someone did a lousy job painting the bathroom door and left a swipe on the tiles. Sink had think cracks, which seemed unacceptable in a room of this caliber. But for sure this is our new NYC base and we feel very fortunate to have found it.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the lower floors”
Reviews.Author: MarkToronto
Reviews.Content: Reviews calling this a slightly faded beauty are correct. Dull but safe uptown location, big rooms, HD TVs, friendly staff, near lots of attractions and subway and a short walk to the park. Big warning: the lower floors are used for movie interview sessions where thousands of cigarettes are smoked. The result was my 3rd floor room absolutely stunk like a thousand dirty ashtrays. The industrial air purifier in each room seems like a perk until you realize that it is fighting a losing battle to the stench. Even smokers will want to insist on a higher floor or a non smoking room and step outside.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cormar
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel on an annual basis for with our Show dog for the Westminster Kennel CLub dog show at Madision Square Gardens each feb, The staff is very friendly, welcomes us back each year and our precious poochies, Loews truly does love PETS. The One bedroom suites are lovely and massive in size, a great little kitchen ( fridge Microwave, sink, small oven , kettle) comes in handy to store your little goodies, The Library in the lobby is a great place for a quick bite or late night snacks and drinks, All the doormen and front desk staff greet you each and every time you enter the hotel. The location of this hotel is amazing, you can walk almost anywhere, and getting a cab is no issue at any time. The rooms do not come cheap $850 a nite for a one bedroom suite, but this hotel is worth every penny...

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Spot”
Reviews.Author: mlizBoston
Reviews.Content: My husband stays here for business one or two nights at a time, about 8 times a year. He travels weekly across the US so he's been in a lot of hotels. The staff here is very pleasant. The rooms are big compared to many other NY hotels of the same price range. It is a unique place in the city and just the right size to offer enough amenities and personal attention. It is always our first choice of hotels if we are traveling together and we want to stay in mid-town.

Reviews.Title: “Tired Looking Hotel Passing off as Luxury - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Sparkly*Euro*Peep
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nicely located on 61st street at Park Avenue - easy walking or subway distance to most places in Manhattan. The lobby is attractive, large and inviting. The room we stayed in was large for NY standards and you could tell it was decorated nicely and it was a luxurious room a few years ago - however, it's tired and shabby and needs a facelift now. Maybe this is because pets are allowed? I don't know the reason but a renovation is in order. I don't really have any complaints about the hotel or service but I didn't deem this as luxury. The bathroom was fairly large but again needed a facelift. The bed was comfortable and the room had all the mod-cons.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely ambience, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Tainc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our two small dogs have just spent a couple of days at the Regency and I would do it again. This is not an inexpensive hotel. Valet parking alone is more than $50 per day and tipping is expected and expensive. (When my husband handed the doorman a $20 bill, asking for change for the tip, the doorman gave him back a $10.00 bill!) But, the room was very nice and a good size with tasteful decorations. Room service was prompt and efficient. My dogs enjoyed the Loew's Loves Pets menu. The location is excellent and the staff is very pleasant. Overall, an enjoyable experience that I would repeat again, but as I said before, it is not even remotely for the budget minded.

Reviews.Title: “Very classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmissner
Reviews.Content: We had a free certificate for a Loew's hotel because of a bad experience at another Loews hotel. This hotel is just lovely. The lobby is understated, the staff very, very welcoming. The room was gorgeous--nicely appointed with home touches, something you would see in Metropolitan Home or Elle Decor Magazines for a master bedroom. The room was huge was an entry way which included a large closet and large bath with double sinks, a separate shower and deep bathtub. The room had several chairs, a lounge, king bed with lovely linens. We were given a nice fruit bowl and two bottles of Fiji water and Hannukah chocolates at turn down. The location is wonderful. We were able to walk to Lincoln Center in 20 minutes at a leisurely pace. It was a most pleasant experience and Loew's redeemed itself.

Reviews.Title: “Everything about this hotel is fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Milly22
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best in New York. Very friendly staff, from the doormen to the concierge!! Beautiful comfortable beds. Close to everything!

Reviews.Title: “The Regency On Park Avenue is good, but a boost is needed”
Reviews.Author: JudeClichy
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at The Regency On Park Avenue too many times to count, and I've always enjoyed the hotel, even with minor quibbles. My stays are the result of business trips. I've noticed that Loew's, which owns the hotel, has placed its name in a more prominent place alongside the words The Regency Hotel. This month my stay was for one night, over Thursday and Friday, I rarely think of Loew's as a luxury-oriented chain, and I think that's the reason things are not as terrific as they once were at The Regency. The bathroom toiletries are less deluxe; seemingly Loew's generic; whereas The Regency used to provide high-end toiletries. The towels are still good; the bath towel is especially fluffy and large. I was stunned to hear, at around 8 a.m. Friday morning, women from Housekeeping knocking on doors on my floor. That's absurd and much too early. This never happened as recently as 2005. And it should not happen at all. The woman tapped on my door and I ignored it. She even tried the door, but the extra "chain-like" security catch was linked, so she couldn't get in. The Reception Desk personnel were friendly, but not quite deluxe. I did not avail myself of the Concierge. The various uniformed gentlemen at the front door were always friendly and provided greetings. They were a little understaffed on Friday afternoon when I needed to get a cab to the airport. The bed was good; the air conditioning/heat fan system worked well. The room was quiet, clean, and pleasant. It was a standard room consisting of a very large and comfortable bed, crisp sheets, dresser, mini-bar (yes, nuttily overpriced), desk, and good size closet. The carpet was fine, although a cosmetic cleaning wouldn't hurt. The view out my 12th floor window was pleasing. I was away from Park Avenue, so the silence was golden. My biggest complaint was with Room Service, which actually blamed a longer waiting period on - get this - the fact that it was raining outside. What? Were they sending out for the food? Food was promised in one hour - ridiculous since the kitchen knows the menu and the foodstuffs are on the premesis. I've always found 30 minutes to be the norm at high-end hotels. I ordered Room Service at around 9:30 p.m. As for the food, well it failed. I ordered a bacon and turkey club sandwich, but it really wasn't a club sandwich at all, but two very large slices of toasted Italian bread with the dull and lifeless sandwich items within. The bread was too thin, thus it was hardish. The sandwich was cut in two sections and was more a panini than a club. My French fries were coolish. Is it so difficult to provide HOT French fries. And I hate cold or cool French fries. The sorbet was fine, well-chilled in a bowl set over ice; therefore it didn't melt as I hate my entree. The chicken soup was good, but not plentiful. And, of course, there was the absurd "delivery fee," which I have found, still find, and always will find offensive. Are we able to go down and get the food ourselves? It isn't called ROOM SERVICE for nothing. This fee is actually an insult. I don't mind the normal 16%, 17%, or 18% tip fee - you live with it, but this delivery fee is so tacky. The Regency has a great location with quick steps to Madison or Fifth Avenue. One big problem is that if you want your own "corner store" or "deli" service, you won't fnd any along this stretch of Park Avenue or even a block up on Madison. I tried.
