You'll need to walk over to Lexington or maybe Third. The shops on Madison begin their high-end run, with Barney's anchoring a corner. The Regency is around 62nd Street and Park. Look, I consider myself fortunate that my work allows me stay in deluxe hotels. There are people who never even travel, let alone get to stay so well around the country. But, hotels that promise luxury need to live up to that claim. The Regency is slipping. My room was clean and pleasant. But overall, the hotel itself needs a little boost. High-end means luxury. And that's what I used to expect and once received from The Regency. It should make a return. Better toiletries in the bathroom would be a start. This stay was average, not wonderful. Definitely not Four Seasons style.

Reviews.Title: “great location, worn out hotel”
Reviews.Author: tripindicular1
Reviews.Content: this hotel has a fabulous location on Park Ave. a block from the best shopping on Madison Ave. Prices are pretty decent for the size of the room, location and NYC in general. Staff are courteous and friendly by NY standards. We had a verly large 1 bedroom suite. The hotel just was not well-maintained or clean enough. There were two phones in the room that did not work. A doorknob was falling off. The hallway carpet was stained and worn and the room was dusty. Housekeeping was very weak when we were there - i.e. they do not throw out an empty soda can unless you put it directly into the trash. Bathrooms are very small....we did have two. I would pay more and stay in a better hotel next time....or even the pay the same and stay someplace like a W that would have a newer, fresher feel. This place is really stale. It's a shame. It has real potential b/ of the location and size of the rooms..

Reviews.Title: “A nice experience”
Reviews.Author: qwertyz4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Regency for 5 nights. The weather was not the greatest, but I can't fault the hotel on that. ;) We stayed in a Luxury Room which was of adequate size for two people. Unlinke others who have noted a "worn out" look to the hotel, we did not find any issues with my room. The bed and sheets were very comfortable. The bathroom was nice, but a bit on the small side. The concierge was fairly helpyful when it came to restaurant and sightseeing recommendations. The doormen were very attentive on weekdays (when the business travellers were there), and less so on weekends (when the families were there). We did not try the room service as it was quite pricey. The cleaning staff was courteous for the most part with the exception of the incident below. We were in the process of changing clothes just before dinner time to go out in the evening, and without any knock or warning, the cleaning lady walked into our room. I let the concierge know about the incident, but they did not really do much other than say "Sorry". One tip ... if you want to use the Internet there, purchase an daily access pass or multi-day access pass directly through WayPort, and not through the hotel directly. We paid $8/day for the Internet, rather than the hotel's rate of $15/day. The nicest touch was the free umbrellas provided at the door one rainy days. They are very nice umbrellas.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DLLS
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for two nights and this hotel was perfect for us! Everything from our large room and the hotel staff were terrific and we honestly didn't have a single complaint. The hotel offers lemonade during the day and when we went to get a glass it was finished. It just so happen a hotel staff person saw that we didn't get any so he called to get more lemonade made and then he called our room to inform us the fresh supply was ready for us! Every single staff member we came in contact with during our stay gave us such good attention and service. Our favorie part of the stay was our amazing large bathroom. It was probably bigger than most NYC apartments. It even had a small television in there! The best part about this room was that we used our reward points to stay and we still were able to get this spacious room. The Regency Hotel is also within walking distance to many attractions. We couldn't have picked a more perfect hotel for our weekend getaway. We look forward to coming back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Sad and Tired”
Reviews.Author: OzzyWayne
Reviews.Content: Surprised to see all the excellent reviews for this hotel. While the staff were very nice, the rooms are old and tired. In the king deluxe room, the bathroom is very small. There is only one sad chair...fine if you are alone on business but a little awkward when traveling as a couple. The wallpaper in the room was a mess and it obviously had not been replaced in along time. The furniture is also quite worn. If you are going into the city on a weekend there are much better hotels for the same money. On the positive side, Feinsteins at the Regency is a great place to hear live music in a very intimate atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay--Perfect for Kids”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Regency for three nights in April. We traveled with our 2 1/2 year old child. PERFECT HOTEL FOR KIDS in a city environment--within quick walking distance of the park (Zoo, flying horses), FAO, Dylan's candy bar etc. The staff was incredibly friendly, especially to our daughter. They gave a gift upon arrival, a welome basket for kids and a nice amenity as well. We were staying in a standard room and found the room to be spacious by city standards and very clean. We didn't feel cramped even with a crib in the room. The bathroom is small but well appointed. We really had no complaints at all about our stay. It is not the Ritz but you aren't paying Ritz prices. The overly nice staff makes up for it and they were more than willing to offer great suggestions for dining or child-friendly excursions.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ciaohawaii
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Regency for 4 nights and we loved it so much! We had 3 rooms but 2 of them were corner room and it was very big beautiful room. We loved the "library"(bar, tea room & salon, I guess) and my grandmother and I hang out there before we go out for dinner. One problem we had was that one one of the room key was not working well and my father couldn't enter his room for a few times. Everytime, they need to fix the room key card but he had to go down for 3 times and that was not pleasant.. But besides that, we adored this hotel. You really get the upper side new york feeling.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Manhattan!”
Reviews.Author: ourfinan
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Regency several times during the past couple of years. Our very first visit made us loyal and each return visit has been better than the last! The location is absolutely perfect and the staff is amazing. During each visit we've seen movie stars, sports stars or famous politicians. I've heard that among celebrities it's known as "Hollywood East". I guess if it's good enough for them . . . it's good enough for us. There may be a nicer hotel somewhere in Manhattan but after 15 years of searching we have't found one. We're always nervous that if we recommend a hotel to friends, perhaps they won't like it as much as we do. This is one of three hotels in America that I'd recommend without hesitation. Several friends have actually come back and thanked us profusely for letting them in on this New York "secret".

Reviews.Title: “This was my 10th stay here”
Reviews.Author: colormemo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Regency at least 10 times in the last four years. The staff is so friendly and I have stayed in the average room and in a couple of the suites. The hotel is vintage and therefor all the rooms are slightly different. I have always had good experiences here and occassionaly have seen a few celebrities which obviously chose the property because they value your privacy. Hot chocolate in the winter and lemonade in the summer!!! My favorite hotel of all in the Big Apple!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great stay....”
Reviews.Author: skryan
Reviews.Content: After much research on where to stay in NYC, we chose the Regency because we wanted to try a hotel on the Upper East Side. When my husband and I first checked in we inquired on the type of room we would have. We had a standard but could buy 120sq.ft. for an additional $40 per night. We decided to check out the room first and decided to stay, figuring we wouldn't spend a lot of time in the room anyways (which we didn't). The room furnishings are nice and for New York standards the room wasn't that small. My only complaint is the bathroom. The bathroom was small and also very warn. The bathroom door was chipped and corroding at the bottom. Another review mentioned a seperate tub and shower, not in this room. Plus there was mold in the shower soap holder. Okay, one more complaint, it was more the norm than not to see housekeeping carts and room service trays in the hall way that was never vacuumed. Our other beef is with the price of room service. We knew it wouldn't be cheap, but these prices are almost gouging. If 2 people ordered 1 hamburger a piece, the price would be $60 and that is without tax and without something to drink - ouch. However, after saying that, our stay was nice. The location is wonderful and the staff, were very friendly, helpful and accomodating. But, next time I think we'll return to Midtown and stay at the Sofitel, where we have stayed before and thoroughly enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Regency”
Reviews.Author: paris1012
Reviews.Content: Our first room was small and dark and the bathroom lights did not work. After pointing that out we did get an upgrade to a fantastic room. Staff was more than willing to help and very responsive. We stayed during a very cold period and the hotel had a really wonderful hot chocolate stand in the lobby....And it was GOOD hot chocolate. Very near Central Park. It's a good walk to the theater district but that was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: momof3maryland
Reviews.Content: We, my two daughters, my mom and I, spent a Saturday night at the Regency, and could not have enjoyed our experience more!!! From the very first phone call to the Regency, to when we left the hotel, we had impeccable service, and an unforgettable experience in NY! Our trip had been planned for my Mom's birthday, and was a surprise to her. We had an executive suite which allowed all of us to stay together, which was ideal. The living room area of the suite allowed all the family to gather for birthday cake after dinner, which was very relaxing and allowed all of us to be comfortable together. Brunch in the Library the next morning was quite a treat, and our waiter, everyone at the front desk, concierge desk, and the doormen were wonderfully solicitous, and provided excellent service. We would love to make a stay at the Regency an annual treat after this incredible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dinocrocetti
Reviews.Content: The Regency might be one of the best in city and possibly the country. The rooms and service were very good. We would definitely stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Loews Regency Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 540 Park Ave, New York City, NY 10021
